title: HR INTERVIEWER (FULL-TIME, AUSTRALIAN CLIENT)
description:
MONTHLY SALARY

?25,000.00



EMPLOYMENT TYPE

Full-time



====================================



OPENING STATEMENT



An established Australian business is looking for a full-time Interviewer / Hiring Manager to conduct and manage initial interviews for our recruitment pipeline. You will help us identify high-quality candidates for our roles and keep our interview calendar productive. This is a long-term position for someone who is reliable, decisive and comfortable with repetitive interviewing. 



====================================



WHAT WE OFFER



* Stable, full-time work (40 hours per week) from Monday to Friday.

* Fixed working hours around midday to 8 p
lbourne time, with occasional flexibility for urgent hiring cycles.

* ?25,000.00 monthly salary.

* Comprehensive training, including examples of strong and weak interviews and shadowing our current interviewer.

* Opportunity to grow into broader hiring or pipeline strategy roles over time. 



====================================



WHAT YOU'LL DO



* Conduct multiple initial interviews each day, adapting your questions based on the candidate's responses.

* Reschedule missed interviews and follow up on candidates who do not attend.

* Track applicant numbers for each role, raise concerns when volume is low and stop interviewing once enough strong candidates are identified.

* Make clear pass or fail decisions and write short notes explaining your reasoning and highlighting strengths and risks.

* Work with the team to understand role priorities and focus your time on urgent positions. 



====================================



REQUIREMENTS



* Strong English communication skills, both spoken and written.

* Confident decision-making and comfort with repetitive interview work.

* Ability to think clearly, ask relevant questions and adapt in real time.

* High personal standards, proactive communication and willingness to flag issues early. 



====================================



NICE TO HAVE



* Previous experience interviewing or recruiting for execution-based roles.

* Experience working with Australian businesses.

* Familiarity with improving interview scripts or hiring systems. 



====================================



SCHEDULE



* Monday to Friday, roughly 12 pm - 8 p
lbourne time.

* Occasional adjustments may be needed to support urgent hiring requests.

title: Experienced Direct Response Copywriter ($2,000 – $4,000 Per Month)
description:
Work Hours: Full-time, Monday to Friday, normal Philippine working hours



Young Publisher | 
/



We’re an international digital publishing company hiring from the Philippines for over 5 years.

We have 50+ tea
mbers worldwide and 200+ verified reviews with a 4.9 average rating.

We build long-term partnerships, not short-term gigs.

We don't disappear, we pay on time



We’re looking for an experienced direct response copywriter who can:

- Take full ownership of performance-driven campaigns

- Write
s that get opened, read, and clicked

- Create Ads that stop people from scrolling.

- Craft persuasive copy that drives readers to act.



This is a full-time remote role with clear growth opportunities. You’ll start with
s and ads, and as you prove yourself, move into sales pages and VSLs.



What you’ll do



- Write broadcast
s and automated sequences

- Create Meta ad copy and video scripts

- Help produce ebooks and lead magnets using AI tools

- Progress into sales pages and VSL scripts for launches



Why is this role different?



- You’ll receive direct feedback from an 8-figure copywriter. This is a serious opportunity to sharpen your skills fast.

- You’ll also get access to premium courses and AI communities. We invest in our team because we want long-term growth.

- We encourage AI tools — but only with strong critical thinking. This is not a beginner role.



Essentials



- Full-time position (Monday–Friday, 8 AM - 5 PM PH Time)

- Long-term position with growth into sales pages and VSLs

- $2,000–$4,000 USD per month, depending on experience

- Fully remote

- Reliable, on-time payments every two weeks via Wise



Requirements



- At least 2 years of direct response copywriting experience (not blog or content writing)

- Proven results: open rates, CTR, conversions, ROAS

- Experience writing for coaches, course creators, or info product businesses

- Native-level English for US, UK, or Australian audiences

- Strong understanding of hooks, emotional triggers, objection handling, and CTAs

- Experience with Meta ad copy and video scripts

- Ability to adapt to different brand voices

- Comfortable using AI tools with critical thinking

- Strong communication skills and independence

- Reliable, responsive, proactive, and coachable



Hiring process



#1: Paid test task

#2: Interview

#3: Paid test month at 50% salary



We’re looking for professionals who know their craft and want long-term growth.



How to apply



Apply via our Typeform here: 
/to/CZb9go1y



Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.



Young Publisher



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Client Success Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,100 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

- Review client content and give actionable feedback

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

- Join daily team check-ins

- Ensure clients follow strategies consistently



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)



- C1+ English (written and spoken) with no accent

- Strong communication skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment



IMPORTANT



When recording a Loom video as part of your application:



- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Content creation and social media experience

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

- Regular usage of AI tools (ChatGPT, CapCut)



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)

Note: More experienced CSMs earn between $1,800 and $2,500 after 6-12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $900+ additional monthly based on:

- Client retention rates

- Task completion metrics

- Quality of feedback

- Team collaboration

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise directly to your bank

- Tools access: We'll cover all the needed tools

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Regular feedback and skill development



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CSM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with client management.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio.



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Executive Assistant to Operations
description:
PLEGA is an Australian-owned assistive technology and care solutions company with over 40 years of experience supporting people living with disability, ageing Australians, and those with complex care needs. We work across private clients, NDIS, aged care, allied health, and commercial partners, delivering high-quality products and services that improve everyday living.



As our business continues to grow, we are seeking one experienced Executive Assistant to support senior leadership and help keep priorities, communication, and projects running smoothly.



About the Role



This is a senior support role suited to someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and enjoys working closely with leadership. You’ll play a key role in managing schedules, coordinating projects, and providing organisational support across the business.



The role also includes assisting with social media coordination and scheduling.



Key Responsibilities

Provide high-level administrative support to the Leadership Team.

Act as a primary point of contact for clients via phone and
.

Schedule, coordinate, and confirm client bookings for deliveries and service calls.

Plan and optimise daily delivery and service routes to ensure operational efficiency.

Utilise the company CRM to create and manage sales orders, approve orders, and generate purchase orders.

Maintain accurate records, documentation, and data entry within internal systems.

Coordinate internal communications between sales, service, and operations teams.

Assist with reporting, tracking, and general administrative tasks as required.





About You

Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or senior support role

Highly organised, proactive, and detail-focused

Confident working directly with senior leadership

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Comfortable using digital tools, calendars, and social platforms

Professional, discreet, and reliable



Why Join PLEGA



Work closely with leadership in a growing Australian business

Be part of meaningful, purpose-driven work

Long-term opportunity for the right candidate

Flexible working arrangements available depending on experience



If you’re looking for a refined Executive Assistant role with real responsibility and impact, we’d love to hear from you.



Please send your resume ONLY to 
 with the Subject: Executive Assistant Application.

title: Junior Video Editor
description:
JOB POST: Junior Video Editor (Economics & Documentary Series)

Company: FISAL Projects (Melbourne, AU)



Role: Part-Time (Ongoing)

Location: Remote (Philippines)



THE MISSION: FISAL Projects is a Melbourne-based media startup producing high-level commentary and documentary content. We are looking for a Rising Post-Production Talent to help grow our two core series:



FISAL Talks: Complex video essays on Global Economics, Business Strategy, and Geopolitics (Style Ref: Vox, Johnny Harris).



The Occupation Records: Cinematic mini-documentaries about unique career paths.



THE ROLE (Entry-Level / Junior): We are not looking for a "vlog" or "social media" editor. We need a Visual Storyteller. While you may be at the start of your career, you must have a deep interest in how information is visualized. You will be given a script and raw "talking head" footage; your job is to help visualize economic concepts using archival footage, data visualization, and clean motion graphics.





Responsibilities:



1. Narrative Editing: Assembling 15–20 minute video essays with a focus on pacing and flow.

2. Basic Motion Graphics: Creating clean assets to explain the script (e.g., animated charts, maps, and kinetic typography).

3. Editorial Judgment: You must have excellent English comprehension to ensure B-roll accurately matches complex economic terms (e.g., "Interest Rates" vs. "Inflation").

4. Audio Setup: Ensuring clear dialogue and balanced background music.





REQUIREMENTS:



1. Software: Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro + After Effects OR DaVinci Resolve.

2. English Mastery: Near-native listening and reading skills are essential for following complex scripts.

3. Hardware: A workstation capable of handling 4K playback and rendering.

4. Internet: Stable Fiber connection (Min 50mbps) for file transfers.





HOW TO APPLY

Subject Line: "Junior Editor Application - [Your Name]"



 us with the following:



1. Your Portfolio: Link to your best work. Even if it is a passion project or school work, show us your storytelling ability.

2. Workstation Specs: Briefly list your CPU/GPU/RAM.

3. Internet Speed: A screenshot of a recent speed test.

4. Answer the following:

     * What is your flat rate for a 15–20 minute video edit (beginner / simple narrative style)? (In PHP)

     **What is your expected daily rate for part-time work (8-hour shift)? (In PHP)

     ***Which editing software do you prefer for motion graphics workflow, and why?

title: FBA Wholesale Account Specialist
description:
Our company is thrilled to announce an incredible opportunity to join our dynamic team as an FBA Wholesale Account Specialist. We are seeking a motivated professional with solid expertise in Wholesale FBA to enhance our business operations and contribute to our continued growth.

- **Product Research**: Identifying profitable products by evaluating market trends, competition, and pricing.

- **Supplier Sourcing**: Establishing partnerships with reliable suppliers and manufacturers, negotiating favorable terms, and securing high-quality products.

- **Inventory Management**: Overseeing stock levels, placing timely orders with suppliers, and ensuring inventory remains balanced to prevent stock shortages.

- **Listing Optimization**: Crafting compelling and keyword-rich product listings that boost visibility and drive conversions.

- **Order Management**: Handling all aspects of order processing, from tracking shipments to managing returns and addressing customer inquiries.

- **Market Analysis**: Conducting competitor research and staying updated on market trends to refine business strategies.

- **Advertising Management**: Creating and managing Amazon PPC campaigns to increase traffic and bolster sales.

title: FRACTIONAL CFO & ECOM DATA ANALYST
description:
THE MISSION



You are the financial architect of the brand.



Your role is to ensure every dollar spent on Meta, TikTok, inventory, or 3PL logistics is accounted for, optimized, and producing a return. You will provide the financial “pulse” that allows leadership to scale aggressively with clarity and confidence.



Our goal is to maintain 100% financial transparency, protect a 35–40% Contribution Margin, and position the company for a $15M+ valuation.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Daily & Monthly P&L Management



• Build and maintain a daily financial P&L (Net Revenue, COGS, Ad Spend, Contribution Margin)

• Monitor financial performance and identify margin fluctuations

• Detect and report money leaks (software waste, team inefficiencies, shipping overages)



3PL Audit & Logistics Analysis



• Weekly reconciliation of 3PL invoices vs Shopify raw data

• Identify billing errors, hidden fees, or overcharges

• Analyze shipping zones, weight classes, and fulfillment costs to protect margins



Inventory Forecasting & Cost Analysis



• Create 30 / 90 / 180-day forecasts aligned with growth and creative launch velocity

• Manage and optimize Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)

• Support planning for large inventory runs: deposits, reorder timing, and cash allocation



Tax & Compliance (AU & US)



• Prepare and submit Australian BAS statements

• Assist with annual tax strategy and compliance (AU + US Sales Tax / Nexus)

• Ensure financial accuracy and audit readiness



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• 3+ years experience working with 8-figure DTC / e-commerce brands

• Advanced proficiency in:

Xero

Shopify (Advanced Reporting)

Google Sheets / Excel (financial modeling & dashboards)

• Strong analytical mindset — able to turn numbers into insights and recommendations

• Experience working with founders and scaling brands preferred



SAMPLE WEEKLY FLOW



Morning: Input Meta/TikTok spend + Shopify sales into Daily P&L

Tuesday: Audit 3PL fulfillment report vs Shopify order IDs

Friday: Present cash flow forecast highlighting upcoming inventory deposits

Quarterly: BAS preparation + US Sales Tax reconciliation



WHY JOIN BEAUTY SLEEP CLUB



• Fast-growing DTC brand with aggressive scaling roadmap

• Work directly with founders and leadership

• High ownership, strategic impact, and growth opportunity

• Flexible remote setup with long-term potential



HOW TO APPLY



Please include:

A short intro about your e-commerce finance experience

Tools you have mastered (Xero, Shopify reporting, forecasting, etc.)

Example of a financial dashboard or forecast you’ve built (screenshot or Loom preferred)



IMPORTANT: Start your application with the phrase “Financial Clarity Drives Growth” so we know you read the full post.

title: Sales Operations & QA VA (CRM, Call Checks, KPI Tracking)
description:
We are hiring a Sales Operations & QA VA.



This is NOT a general VA role.

This is a process enforcement and quality control role for a sales team.



Your job is to:



- Check that sales reps follow process



- Verify data accuracy



- Catch mistakes



- Report issues clearly and immediately



You will be working closely with sales calls, CRM data, calendars, and KPIs.



If you like structure, checklists, and holding standards, this role is for you.



If you need constant instruction or dislike checking other people’s work, do NOT apply.



Core Responsibilities



- Check that closers call leads on time



- Verify call attendance using:



       - CRM notes



       - Call recordings



       - Booking sheets



- Ensure closers:



       - Leave correct notes after every call



       - Select correct outcomes in CRM



       - Move deals correctly



- Track:



      - Show-ups



     - Reschedules



     - Cancellations



- Spot-check call recordings to confirm notes match what actually happened



- Report missed or late calls in the sales Slack channel



 - Monitor closer calendars and ensure:



      - Required calendar blocks exist



      - No bookings are moved without approval



- Ensure hot transfers are posted in Slack and followed up if not accepted



- Take call transcripts and use ChatGPT to:



        - Identify weekly team issues



       - Spot repeated objections



        - Confirm correct offers are being pitched



- Help maintain clean KPI tracking in GoHighLevel (GHL)



Accuracy matters more than speed.



How to Apply (Important)



To apply, you must answer ALL questions below.



Short or generic answers will be rejected.



Question 1

Imagine a sales rep marked a call as “Showed Up” in the CRM, but when you listen to the call recording, the lead never answered.



Explain step-by-step what you would do next.



Question 2

You notice a closer is leaving very short notes like “Good call” or “Follow up later”.



What exact problem does this cause for the business, and how would you fix it?



Question 3

Write the words “I read the full job description” at the top of your application.



Applications without this will be ignored.

title: EXPERIENCED COLD CALLER & APPOINTMENT SETTER
description:
READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION, READ IT, READ IT & READ IT



IF YOU COME FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE, YOU ARE ALREADY IN THE WRONG PLACE. CLOSE THIS TAB & DO NOT WASTE OUR TIME, DO NOT COME SAYIN YOU ARE CONFIDENT YOU CAN DO IT, WE NEED EXPERTISE.



We are not interested in your call center background, your inbound experience, your bank loan processing history, or your debt collection tenure. None of that qualifies you here. We need people who have picked up a phone, called a complete stranger who never asked to be called, and booked them into a meeting for a marketing agency. If that is not your exact background, do not apply. We are not training anyone. We are not giving anyone a chance to prove themselves. We want people who have already done this and are ready to do it again.



And before you even think about it — real estate cold calling does not count. We do not care that you called homeowners or followed up on listings. That is a completely different world. Do not use that as your experience to apply here.



The salary listed is not an invitation for career changers or people looking for a foot in the door. It is what you earn when you perform. Read that again.



---



WHO YOU WILL BE CALLING — READ THIS CAREFULLY



You will be calling contractors across the USA and Canada. Plumbers, roofers, HVAC guys, electricians. These people get bombarded with cold calls every single day. Hundreds of them. They have heard every scripted opener, every "Hi sir, how are you doing today", every fake cheerful introduction — and they hang up before you finish your sentence.



If your style is formal, stiff, or scripted — do not apply. SERIOUSLY, DO NOT. You will burn through the list and produce nothing.



The only people who get these guys to stay on the phone are the ones who talk to them like a normal human being. Casual. Direct. No fluff. Think less "Good afternoon sir, my name is John and I am calling on behalf of" and more "Hey man, got a quick second?" If that is not how you naturally operate on a cold call, this is not your job and we do not want to hear from you. Move on.



---



THE JOB



You will receive a list of 5,000 cold leads. You call every single one. You book appointments. You log every outcome. You confirm every booking with a check-in call 2 hours before the meeting. That is the job. Nothing less qualifies as complete.



---



HOW PAYMENT WORKS



- $600 USD is your fixed base — paid only when all 5,000 contacts have been called and all outcomes are fully logged

- Partial completion does not qualify for any payment under any circumstance

- Bonuses are paid on top of the base and determined by confirmed, qualified bookings only



Below 200 bookings — $600 base only. No bonus. No exceptions.

200–219 bookings — $600 + $500 bonus = $1,100 USD total

220–249 bookings — $600 + $750 bonus = $1,350 USD total

250+ bookings — $600 + $1,900 bonus = $2,500 USD total + monthly ongoing role offered



A booking only counts when the prospect is genuinely qualified, understands what the meeting is about, and has been confirmed via a check-in call approximately 2 hours before their scheduled time. Inflated, weak, or misleading bookings are not counted and will reflect on your review. In other words ... if you just book just to get the 250+ bookings, that will not count.



---



WHAT YOU ARE EXPECTED TO DO



- Work through all 5,000 leads in a disciplined, systematic way

- Attempt each lead up to 3 times at varied times of day before marking as unreachable — morning, midday, and afternoon or evening windows

- Pitch naturally, qualify fast, and book only prospects who genuinely fit

- Log every call outcome and note into our CRM or tracking sheet

- Send confirmation details to every booked prospect immediately after booking

- Call every booked prospect approximately 2 hours before their meeting to confirm attendance — if they need to reschedule, handle it on the spot, update the calendar, and log the change

- Submit a full outcome report once the list is complete



---



PERFORMANCE BENCHMARKS



- 200 bookings (4%) — Minimum to qualify for full payment

- 225 bookings (4.5%) — Strong performance

- 250+ bookings (5%+) — Outstanding. A monthly role with a good 4 digit salary (2-3-4k a month) might be offered.



---



REQUIREMENTS



- Proven outbound cold calling experience specifically for marketing agencies — this is non-negotiable

- Real estate cold calling does not count — do not list it as relevant experience

- Fluent, confident English with no heavy accent, mumbling

- Natural and human on the phone — not robotic, not scripted-sounding

- Able to handle rejection and keep dialing without losing energy or discipline

- Able to accurately qualify leads during the call — not just push anyone into a slot to inflate numbers

- Disciplined with follow-through — the pre-meeting confirmation call is mandatory, not optional

- Reliable internet and a quality headset — audio must be crystal clear

- Able to work fully independently with zero supervision

- Able to complete the full project within a reasonable timeframe

- Familiar with GHL or Google Sheets for tracking

title: Operations Support
description:
*DO NOT APPLY WITHOUT ATTACHING YOUR CV AS YOUR APPPLICATION WILL BE SKIPPED*

*PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE IN OPERATIONS / TRANSPORT IS A MUST*



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a BPO Staff Member to support our operations on a national level, with a primary focus on Perth. You will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth daily management of our removals and storage services, assisting in various operational tasks, and working closely with our local teams. If you're looking for a dynamic and rewarding role with room for growth, we'd love to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:



Daily Rostering of Staff: Assist in planning and assigning shifts, ensuring optimal staff coverage for all operations.



Booking Accuracy Confirmation: Double-check and confirm the accuracy of job details and bookings to avoid discrepancies.



Daily Storage Movement Reporting: Track and report the daily flow of storage modules in and out of our facilities.



Container Movement Bookings: Coordinate with external providers to arrange timely and efficient container movements.



Customer Service Liaison: Work with the customer service team to address any complaints or claims, ensuring timely resolution.



Storage Module Tracking: Keep a close eye on the location and condition of storage modules, updating records as necessary.

Commercial Job Reporting: Assist in preparing reports for commercial jobs, ensuring accurate information for invoicing.



Moveware Task Management: Create and manage tasks and deadlines within the Moveware system to ensure efficient workflow.



Paperwork Checks: Perform daily reviews of necessary paperwork (including signatures, ICRs, forms), ensuring compliance and updates.



Weekly Job Planning: Help in planning and preparing for upcoming jobs, anticipating operational needs.



 Communication: Maintain regular
 communication with internal teams and external partners, providing updates as required.



Requirements:



Previous experience in an administrative, operations, or support role (preferably in logistics, removals, or a related field).

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office and other relevant software.

Familiarity with Moveware or similar Removals Software systems is an advantage.

Ability to work independently while being part of a larger remote team.

Why Join Us?

You’ll be part of a dynamic team working across multiple locations, with a primary focus on our Perth operations. We offer competitive compensation, opportunities for growth, and a chance to work with a respected removals and storage company that values efficiency, teamwork, and customer satisfaction.



If you are motivated, dependable, and ready to take on a new challenge, apply now and help us keep our operations running smoothly!

title: AI Automation Developer - Claude Code
description:
We're building something most businesses haven't even realised is possible.



Pet Let is an Australian holiday rental company that's been operating since 2009. We have a large property portfolio, a team across two countries, and a database of more than 13,000 guests.

And we're in the middle of building a fully AI-powered operation.

Not chatbots. Not auto-replies. A genuine network of AI agents that can run core business functions — guest communications, operations coordination, financial processing, reporting, and marketing — with a lean human team providing oversight and handling what genuinely needs human judgment.

We have a diverse tech stack including a property management system, a property operations and task management platform, trust accounting software, and Google Workspace as our communications and data backbone. Your job is to connect all of it to Claude, and build agents and dashboards on top of those connections that make the whole business smarter and faster.

We know where we're going. We need someone to help us get there.



What the role looks like:

You'll work directly with our CEO and Operations Manager. You'll design, build, and deploy — hands on, every day.  You ask questions, dig deep, can understand business processes.  You think and understand fast.  



The work has two major pillars:

AI agents — using MCP servers to connect Claude directly to our business systems, then building agents that can act autonomously across those systems: receiving inputs, making decisions, triggering actions, and closing the loop without a human in the middle.



Live dashboards — building real-time operational and business dashboards that give leadership and each team a clear view of what's happening and what needs attention. You choose the right tool for the job.



Beyond that, the roadmap is broad and the problems are real. You'll have genuine ownership of meaningful work from day one.



Who we're looking for

You live in Claude. You've shipped Claude Artifacts. You use Claude Cowork and Code daily and you love letting it do the heavy lifting while you direct the outcome.  Clawdbot/Moltbot/OpenClaw blew your mind.  And now the hype is over, you get what the future looks like and you want to ride that wave.  



You understand MCP — ideally you've built MCP servers and you get why they're the key to turning Claude from an assistant into an agent that can actually act in real systems.

You know Python. You can read an API and build a connection. You've built dashboards that pull live data and help people make decisions.

You don't need to be managed. You need a clear problem and the trust to solve it.

Honestly? We're looking for someone who gets so excited about this stuff that the idea of locking yourself away with your favourite drink, your favourite snacks, and a massive problem to solve sounds less like work and more like the best possible way to spend a day. Our CEO is currently losing sleep because she's so energised by what's possible. We want someone who gets that feeling.



Non-negotiable:



Fluent in Python

Deep, daily Claude user — Artifacts, Claude Code, the works

Understands and has worked with MCP

Has built things with the Claude or OpenAI API and can show us

Can build interactive dashboards connected to live data

Strong written English

Self-directed and genuinely motivated by this technology



Strong advantage:



Google Workspace API experience

Workflow automation (n8n, Make, Zapier)

Experience with agentic frameworks

Any background in hospitality, property management, or operational businesses





About the salary — let's be straight with you

We're starting at $800–$1,200 USD/month. We'll be honest about why: we've been burnt before by people who interview well but can't execute. So we start cautious.

But here's the flip side. If you can do what this ad describes — if you can take our vision and actually ship it, fast — your value to us goes up dramatically and your rate will reflect that. We'll review your compensation as soon as the first element of the vision is live and working, which could be within the first two weeks. After that, regular reviews tied directly to progress.

We're not looking for someone to pay minimally and keep there. We're looking for someone who proves they're exceptional and then gets rewarded for it. If that's you, this is a very good opportunity.



What we offer



Contract  — 40 hours/week

Bonus

Starting remuneration of $800–$1,200 USD/month with fast review based on delivery

Direct access to decision-makers — no layers, no bureaucracy

Real ownership of a genuinely ambitious project

A business that is all-in on this and moving fast





How to apply

Send us three things:



Who you are and why this excites you — keep it honest and specific

Something you've built using Claude or another AI API — a link, a repo, a demo, a description. Show us how you think and what you ship

Your answer to this: If you were connecting Claude to a business system via MCP, what's the first tool you'd expose and why?



Applications without examples of real work will not be considered.



Pet Let has been making holidays better for pet owners since 2009. We think AI is about to let us do that at a level that simply wasn't possible before. Come help us build it.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Monday CRM Buildout
description:
CRM – Monday Requirements

 & Contact Management

-
s we send and receive should automatically sync into the CRM. It should

populate to one place where I then d
 to add it or remove it if it is not an

we need.

- Every
 address should be linked to a contact record. It should be categorized

by customer/vendor, as well as the company.

- Companies should have their own contact/hub, which will also have each

employee inside the company.

- Ability to tag/sort vendors by what they produce (labels, coloring books, checks,

etc.) so they’re easy to filter and
 blasts can be sent based on the item I am

looking for.

- Companies should have multiple tags since some vendors do multiple things.

- There should be one or 2
s associated with the
 blast that will be sent out

so multiple people at the company are not getting the same “request for a quote.”

- Ability to blast RFQs to selected vendors with name/company auto-filled so it feels

personal, as well as pre made templates.

- After submitting a quote, automatically schedule a follow-up for when the bid ends.

- Automatic
 sent to previous customers after x amount of time has passed to

follow up and see how they are doing.

- Be able to send
 blasts to customers for promotional products that we are

running a special on or lead generation.

Bids & Job Tracking

Create a project/job for each bid & track multiple vendor quotes inside one job, organized

by:

- Date it needs to be submitted

- Vendors to be contacted

- Who we contacted

- What the status is

- What the cost is

- Lead time

- Shipping

- Etc.

Track deal states:

- RFQ

- Reached out to vendors

- Submitted the quote/bid

- Won job/purchase order received

- We create a purchase order

- Acknowledgment received

- Tracking received

- Invoiced customer

- Billed us

- Customer received order

-
 to follow up and ensure it all went well

Alerts if no change in x amount of days, ensure we stay on top of it.

Automated triggers (example: move stage when PO is uploaded).

Can we integrate with shipping company to track package and update status for us?

Financial Tracking

- Track our cost vs selling price per job that we submit.

- Built-in markup formula that they recommend for the job.

- Visibility into profitability per job.

- Track bids submitted vs won/lost.

Vendor Tracking

- Track jobs vendors have completed & price.

- Which vendor we use the most, how their price increases.

- What items each vendor produces for which clients normally.

title: Operations Manager for Neurodivergence Coach (ADHD + autism + Mental Health)
description:
>> I'm wanting to work with women only (I want to support women!) <<



I'm a neurodivergence coach originally from Korea, now living in LA. I work with creative, multi-passionate adults who want to build fulfilling lives by working with their nervous system.



My business and life are growing very quickly, and I need an exceptional operations manager / executive assistant—someone in the top 5–10%—to help me take things to the next level.



You'll be my operational partner, making decisions on my behalf and keeping both my business and personal life running smoothly.



I'd love for us to become friends, not just employer-employee. I've experienced this with my previous assistants and it's been really fulfilling.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You'll be acting on my behalf—calling banks, vendors, and service providers, making real-time decisions, and managing personal and business logistics independently.



This is a dynamic, fast-paced and constantly evolving role. Things move quickly without step-by-step instructions, and you'll need exceptional judgment and discretion.



If you love taking initiative, solving problems creatively, and owning projects end-to-end, this could be the perfect role for you.





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING 



- Keep in communication with vendors, service providers—handle situations independently

- Keep track of different dates & deadlines and follow through until completion

- Managing and maintaining multiple projects, tasks and systems 

- Conduct in-depth research and troubleshoot issues 

- Manage bookkeeping for business and personal finances





WHO WILL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE 



- Highly independent and proactive, able to act and d
 on my behalf across personal and business matters

- Exceptional decision-making and sound judgment in a variety of contexts and situations

- Clear, concise, and direct communicator – able to give clear feedback on what is working, what is not, suggestions & improvements

- Adaptable and resourceful, able to navigate new tools, platforms, and situations quickly

- Exceptionally organized and able to prioritize very effectively when many things feel time-sensitive 

- Able to own and execute projects from beginning to end 

- Comfortable managing complex and multiple priorities without dropping anything (daily tasks PLUS multiple side projects—all at once)





HOURS 



- 40 hours/week, Monday–Friday PST (Tuesday–Saturday PH time preferred but weekend time can be adjusted)

- Will meet, do work together, and do dody-doubling (co-working) at 4PM to 9 PM PST (7 or 8 am - 12nn or 1 am)





PAY & BENEFITS



- $1,400–$1,700/month, pay increases as you grow

- Severance pay 

- 30 days off per year (flexible)  





MY COMMITMENT TO YOU

I treat my teammates with respect and love. We're constantly learning and evolving together. I'm interested in you as a human being, beyond just our work—and I'll compensate you fairly and generously for outstanding work. 





DON'T APPLY IF: 



- You're early in your career without proven project / operations managing experience

- You struggle with independent decision-making or need guidance on execution

- You feel overwhelmed in high-responsibility, high-autonomy environments

- You're looking for a short-term role or stepping stone

- You feel uncertain or hesitant about this role





>>>If this sounds like the job for you, you can read more and apply at the link below<<


/virtual-assistant

title: Graphic Designer (Print-On-Demand / Etsy)
description:
About the Role

I am looking for a Virtual Assistant with Graphic Design experience who has worked with Print on Demand (POD) products and Etsy shops.

I currently manage 2 Etsy shops:

1 established shop that is in the top 3% of all Etsy shops

1 newer shop launched December 2025

This role focuses on design creation and Etsy listing visuals for products such as wall art, candles, apparel, blankets, mugs, and similar POD items.

This position is best for someone who:

Understands Etsy design aesthetics

Can follow reference designs while applying good design judgment

Is organized, detail-oriented, and communicates clearly



Main Responsibilities

1. Design Creation

You will be assigned a Google Sheet containing:

Reference links to similar designs

Clear instructions for what needs to be created



Most designs are:

Simple patterns

Frames

Color palette variations

Font changes or combinations

Some designs include quotes or design styles that must be applied across multiple products

You must:

Follow specific dimension requirements

Ensure correct centering and alignment

Create multiple variations when requested (patterns, colors, fonts)



2. Support Product Images (Listing Slides)

Some listings offer design choices such as:

Pattern options

Font styles

Color palettes

You will create clear listing image slides that explain these choices to buyers

These images must be:

Easy to understand

Clean and professional

Optimized for Etsy shoppers



Sample Tasks & Reference Listings

These links are examples only of the type of work you may be assigned.



Reference 1 – Font/Text-Based Apparel Design


/listing/
Task Example:

Create a monochrome color palette for each shirt color

Ensure good text contrast and readability

Name all design files using a SKU-based naming format

Usually a one-off task

Occasionally, you may need to create a main mockup image for grouped shirts

(I use bulk mockup software for most single-design main images)



Reference 2 – Multi-Design Product with Design Choices


/listing/
Task Example:

This is a multi-design listing

I will provide access to my Creative Fabrica account

Use it ONLY to download design elements

No need to design elements from scratch

Create product image slides that show:

Design element options (20–30 options is enough)

Create a personalization instruction slide clearly pointing out:

Top text (personalizable)

Design element choice

Bottom text and placement



Reference 3 – Pattern & Color Choice Product


/listing/
Task Example:

Create a “Choose Your Pattern” image slide

Create a “Choose Your Mug Color” image slide

Slides must clearly separate:

Pattern choices

Product color choices



Source File Requirement (IMPORTANT)

For all designs and listing images, you must provide:

An editable source file

PSD or Canva

Choose whichever is best for future personalization edits

Files must be:

Well-organized

Clearly labeled

Easy to edit by another tea
mber



Required Skills

Communication

Send a daily Slack update that includes:

What you completed today

What you plan to work on next

If there is a problem or blocker, you must notify me at least 24 hours in advance



Design & Tools

You must be comfortable using:

Photoshop (for detailed or intricate edits)

Canva (patterns, layouts, fonts, variations)

Creative Fabrica (elements only, used with original designs)

Strong eye for design

Ability to choose appropriate fonts, patterns, and color palettes

Willingness to give design recommendations when needed



Work Schedule

Monday – Friday (PDT time)

Philippines time: Sunday – Thursday

Exact working hours are flexible

Work is deadline-based, not hourly



Pay

$300 per month with growth opportunities at 6-month , 12-month and beyond. This is an opportunity that we're looking to have a long term employment.



How to Apply (READ CAREFULLY)

1. Subject Line

Use this exact subject line:

“I am the VA + Graphic Designer you are looking for!”



2. Portfolio

Provide your portfolio or samples

Bonus points if you include:

Pattern design work

Color palette variations

Font / typography samples

Etsy or Print on Demand-related designs



3. Answer These Questions

Please answer the following in your application:

Do you have experience working with Etsy shops? Please describe.

Have you worked with Print on Demand products before? Which products?

Which tool are you stronger in: Photoshop or Canva?

Are you comfortable creating multiple variations of the same design, especially from the examples provided above?

How do you manage deadlines and daily reporting?

This is NOT a typical VA role where you answer a few
s. You will be the frontline of our customer experience — handling tickets, managing reviews, coordinating with our fulfillment partner, and making sure every customer interaction is fast, friendly, and resolved properly.



We have detailed SOPs, pre-written response templates, and clear escalation rules. You will follow established systems, and help improve them. If you’re someone who thrives with clear processes and takes pride in executing them perfectly, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do Every Day

• Respond to all customer support tickets via our helpdesk (CommSlayer) using pre-built macros and templates. You will rarely write a response from scratch — we have a macro for almost every scenario.

• Monitor and manage our Shopify admin: check order statuses, process exchanges, initiate refunds, update customer information, and resolve order issues.

• Respond to Trustpilot reviews. Negative reviews (1-3 stars) get priority and follow a specific recovery process.

• Coordinate with our fulfillment partner: replacement shipments, product quality concerns, tracking issues, and stock-level questions. Communication is via
 in English.

• Arrange exchanges and returns: confirm new size with customer, create replacement order in Shopify, send return instructions, track that the process completes.

• Flag and escalate problems that fall outside normal SOPs to the team lead or business owner via Slack. You will have clear rules on what to escalate and when.

• Maintain a daily log of any recurring issues, unusual complaints, or product quality concerns so we can spot problems early.



Weekly Responsibilities

• Friday audit: Review the week’s tickets and provide a 5-line summary — total tickets, average response time, any unresolved issues, Trustpilot rating, and the most common complaint theme that week.

• Ensure zero unresolved tickets at end of each business day (responded to or escalated).

• Keep our FAQ and macro library updated — if you notice a new question coming up repeatedly, flag it so we can create a macro for it.



Tools You’ll Use

• CommSlayer (helpdesk / ticket management)

• Shopify (order management, refunds, exchanges)

• Trustpilot (review monitoring and responses)

• Slack (team communication and escalations)

• Google Sheets (daily logging and reporting)



Requirements

• Minimum 1 year experience in eCommerce customer support (Shopify experience strongly preferred)

• Excellent written English — friendly, natural, casual tone (not corporate or robotic)

• Experience processing refunds, exchanges, and returns in Shopify

• Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace

• Available to work Australian business hours (AEST) or overlap with them significantly

• Detail-oriented — you follow SOPs exactly as written, every time

• You can handle a moderate volume of tickets (60 per day) without rushing or cutting corners



Bonus (Not Required)

• Experience with CommSlayer, Gorgias, or Zendesk

• Experience with Trustpilot or other review platforms

• Experience communicating with Chinese suppliers/fulfillment partners

• Experience setting up customer service automations or macros



Schedule & Compensation

• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• Schedule: Monday to Friday, with some weekend monitoring required (check and respond to urgent tickets on Saturday — typically 30 minutes)

• Hours: Flexible, but must overlap with Australian business hours (9am-5pm AEST) for at least 4-5 hours daily

• Compensation: dependent on experience, with review after 90 days based on performance

• Paid via direct bank transfer monthly

• This is a long-term role. We want someone who will grow with the company as we launch additional brands.



How We Work

We’re a small, fast-moving team. The business owner handles creative strategy and advertising. We have editors, a graphic designer, and you’ll be the customer-facing person. Communication happens on Slack. We don’t micromanage — but we do have clear KPIs:

• First response time: under 4 hours during business hours

• All tickets resolved or escalated by end of day

• 100% of Trustpilot reviews responded within 24 hours

• Refund rate stays under 5%

• Zero freestyle responses — every reply uses an approved macro or template



You’ll receive comprehensive SOPs, a complete macro library, and full training in the first week. We don’t expect you to figure things out on your own — we expect you to follow the systems we’ve built and flag anything that doesn’t fit.



How to Apply

IMPORTANT: Applications that do not follow these instructions will be immediately rejected.

To apply, send a message that includes ALL of the following:

1. Start your message with the word "PINEAPPLE" so we know you read this entire posting.

2. A brief description of your most recent eCommerce customer support role (company name, how long, what tools you used, how many tickets per day).

3. Write a sample response to this customer ticket: "I ordered a Large but I think I need an XL. Can I swap it?" — Write it in a friendly, casual tone. Do NOT use AI to write this.

4. Your available working hours in AEST (Australian Eastern Standard Time).

5. Your expected monthly salary in USD.

We review applications within 3 business days. Shortlisted candidates will do a short paid trial task before final hiring.

title: Full Time Video Editor for YouTube Videos
description:
We’re looking for a skilled Video Editor to take ownership of YouTube long-form content, including educational videos and vlogs, while also supporting short-form clips for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is ideal for someone who understands YouTube retention, pacing, and storytelling, not just technical editing. You’ll be working with high-impact content in the entrepreneurship, ecommerce, and personal brand space.



Responsibilities:

Long-Form YouTube Editing (Primary Focus)

Edit long-form YouTube videos (10–45 minutes) with strong pacing and flow

Create engaging hooks, pattern interrupts, and clean transitions to maximize retention

Edit vlog-style content while maintaining authenticity and energy

Add b-roll, screen recordings, text overlays, and light motion graphics where appropriate

Clean up audio, remove filler, and improve overall production quality

Short-Form Support (Secondary Focus)

Repurpose long-form content into short-form clips (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)

Collaborate on identifying 
nts with viral or high-engagement potential



Must-Have Skills:

Strong experience editing YouTube long-form content (ideally with experience working on Personal Brands) 

Excellent sense of pacing, storytelling, and viewer retention

Proficiency in editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve)

Strong audio cleanup skills (noise reduction, leveling, clarity)



How to Apply:

In your application subject line included VID3O (if you miss this step you application will be skipped)

A short intro about your experience

2–5 examples of YouTube long-form edits (required)

Any short-form examples (optional but preferred)

title: Full-Time Influencer & UGC Talent Manager (Nordic Markets – Sweden Focus)
description:
About Us:



We are a fast-growing Scandinavian e-commerce group operating multiple direct-to-consumer brands across Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark.



We scale products aggressively through paid media (Meta, TikTok, Snapchat) and are now expanding our influencer and UGC acquisition efforts significantly.



We are looking for a serious, performance-driven Influencer & UGC Talent Manager who knows exactly how to find, evaluate and negotiate with creators in the Nordic markets — especially Sweden.



???? Your Role



You will be responsible for:



Sourcing high-converting influencers & UGC creators (Sweden primary, Norway, Finland & Denmark secondary)



Identifying creators that match specific product angles and target audiences



Outreach & negotiation of collaborations



Structuring performance-based deals when possible



Evaluating creators based on engagement, audience quality & ad suitability



Building long-term creator pipelines



Tracking results and continuously improving creator quality



This is NOT basic mass outreach.



We need someone who understands:



Where to find hidden UGC talent



How to detect fake engagement



What type of content converts in paid ads



How to negotiate pricing professionally



How to build win-win long-term partnerships



???? Requirements



You must have:



Proven experience sourcing influencers or UGC creators



Strong English communication skills



Experience working with European/Nordic markets (preferred)



Fast response time



Strong negotiation ability



Understanding of performance-driven e-commerce



Bonus:



Experience working with Meta or TikTok Ads teams



Understanding of Swedish/Nordic consumer behavior



???? Compensation



Base salary: $700–$1000/month (depending on experience)



Strong performance-based compensation



We reward results.



If you consistently:



Bring high-quality creators



Negotiate strong deals



Secure collaborations that perform well in paid ads



Your compensation will grow significantly.



???? IMPORTANT – Read Carefully Before Applying



If you do not answer the questions below clearly and specifically, your application will not be considered.



Have you previously worked with influencer sourcing or UGC acquisition?



Describe concretely HOW you have worked:



How do you find creators?

Whitelisting?



Performance deals?



Affiliate?



Long-term brand ambassadors?



What results did your collaborations lead to?



Engagement metrics?



Ad performance?



Revenue impact?



Cost savings from negotiation?



We are not looking for general answers.

Be specific. Show us your process.



We are hiring immediately and looking for someone long-term.

title: Australian End to End Parabroker / Credit Analyst  3+Years Experience Needed
description:
Senior Credit Analyst / Para Broker

Pathway to Team Lead – Australian Mortgage Lending



Salary: 45,000 – 100,000 / month - remuneration based on experience

+performance incentives

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Role Type: Full-time | Long-term

*part-time welcome to apply if you have experience



About Us – Yippee Finance



Yippee Finance is an established Australian mortgage brokerage working primarily with property investors across:

->Residential & investment lending

->SMSF lending

->Commercial & complex income scenarios



We’re building a scalable offshore credit team and are hiring a high-calibre Credit Analyst / Para Broker with a clear pathway to leadership.



The Opportunity

This is a senior credit role, not a junior processing position.

You will work directly with the Australian broker, owning credit quality end-to-end.

Tasks include document verification, credit assessment, and lender strategy.

There will be a pathway to leadership.



What You’ll Be Doing (Senior-Level)

This role is for someone who is truly broker-ready, able to run files end-to-end with high accuracy, professional judgement and speed.



You will be responsible for the full loan lifecycle:



1. Pre-Assessment & Fact-Finding

>Reviewing application details, fact-finding forms, and clarifying gaps with clients

> Understanding complex income structures

(PAYG, company, trust, SMSF, trading business income, distributions, addbacks)

> Identifying missing documents and obtaining them via
/sms.

> Organising and QC-ing all documents prior to entering into MyCRM

> Document renaming

> Document verification – documents can be used to submit to lenders.



2. Application Entry & Servicing Assessment

>Entering all client, financial, and security details into MyCRM (LMG)

> Accurately interpreting financial statements, tax returns, NOAs, payslips, BAS, trust

deeds, SMSF documentation.

If you don’t know how to read payslips and don’t understand allowances.

This role is not for you.

> Running full servicing and borrowing capacity calculations using Quickli (or lender calculators as needed) – This is a must have

> Identifying potential servicing issues early and flagging structuring options

> Producing a recommended shortlist of lenders based on policy, servicing outcome, turnaround times, and product fit



3. Structuring & Lender Recommendation

> Preparing a preliminary lending strategy for broker review

> Summarising policy considerations, servicing notes, pricing notes

> Providing a recommended lender and product selection with justification

> Tailoring strategy for:

o Multi-property investors

o SMSF purchases

o Trust/company structures

o Commercial lending (basic)



4. Submission & Compliance

> Preparing SOCA / Gameplan in line with NCCP obligations

> Preparing compliance notes and document checklists – to review

> Completing AOL submission with correct supporting documents

> Communicating with BDMs when clarifications are needed

> Maintaining file logs and status updates inside MyCRM



5. Post-Lodgement & Settlement Management

>Ordering valuations, following up with lenders, and tracking SLAs

> Managing outstanding conditions and liaising with clients

> Preparing files for settlement, including discharge forms, variation forms, and

settlement instructions

> Coordinating with solicitors, agents, lenders, and settlement teams

> Sending scheduled post-settlement client touchpoints & Yippee Finance scripts



What We’re Looking For - Key Skills & Requirements

Mandatory 3+ years experience as a credit analyst / parabroker in AU mortgage broking.

Strong experience with investor lending, trust structures, SMSF and commercial basics

>High-level proficiency in MyCRM (LMG) and Quickli

> Strong understanding of the entire end-to-end mortgage process

> Highly accurate income shading, addbacks, servicing, and policy interpretation skills

>Ability to work independently and make preliminary recommendations

> Excellent English communication skills

> High organisational skills and attention to detail



Experience using:

MyCRM / Mercury / Salestrekker (or similar)

Quickli or servicing tools



**Highly Regarded

SMSF lending exposure

Commercial lending

Mentoring or reviewing junior analysts

Desire to move into a lead / management role

Certificate IV in Mortgage broking



Career Progression 



12 Months

Senior Credit Analyst / Para Broker



24 Months

Senior Para Broker – file reviews & quality control



36 Months

Team Lead – Credit & Packaging

(Manage analysts, oversee quality, improve workflows)



This is not a dead-end offshore role.



Compensation & Benefits - Paid based on experience. 



45,000 – 100,000/month base - remuneration based on experience only

Performance bonuses

Annual salary review

Long-term Australian role

Direct access to the broker

Stable workload & clear expectations



Why This Role Stands Out



Australian investor lending exposure

Credit ownership + document verification

Leadership pathway

Competitive, respectful pay

Long-term stability



How to Apply?

Please include:

Your Australian mortgage experience

CRMs & calculators used

Example of a complex deal you assessed, including document review challenges

Tell me which guest I interviewed in my podcast that specialises in Commercial investing.
