title: Part-Time Social Media Manager - LinkedIn + Design + Video + Blog/SEO (B2B)
description:
About OpSec



OpSec Consulting is a Managed Service Provider (MSP) and low-voltage integration company specializing in Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNFs) in the U.S. We work on systems like nurse call, wander management, access control, fire alarm, delayed egress, and surveillance, plus fixed-fee IT.



We are hiring one person to operate as our in-house marketing team focused on LinkedIn growth + visibility, plus blog content for SEO, and trade show marketing support.



This is not a basic “schedule posts” job. We need someone who can own the strategy and execution.



What you will do (Responsibilities)

1) LinkedIn strategy + content creation (primary)



* Build our LinkedIn strategy: positioning, content pillars, cadence, voice, goals



* Create a monthly content plan + weekly queue



* Write high-quality LinkedIn posts in a US business tone:



* Thought leadership, educational posts, credibility-building stories



* Security/IT/low-voltage insights for nursing homes and healthcare facilities



* Behind-the-scenes, culture, wins, lessons learned, project highlights



* Turn rough notes / voice messages into polished content with minimal back-and-forth



2) Engagement for reach (daily)



* Comment on posts from my LinkedIn network to increase visibility:



* Comments must be thoughtful and specific (not “Great post!”)



* Aim is to start conversations and build authority



3) Graphic design for LinkedIn



* Design post visuals: carousels, one-pagers, simple diagrams, quote cards



* Create a consistent style using templates (clean + professional)



4) Video content (short-form)



* Create short LinkedIn videos:



* Edits from provided footage (job sites, trade shows, team clips)



* Captions, basic motion graphics, hooks



* Tools like CapCut/Premiere/DaVinci are fine



5) Blog content + SEO (website)



* Write and publish blog posts for our website focused on SEO:



* Keyword-informed topics relevant to SNFs, low voltage, security, and IT



* Clear structure: headings, internal links, meta titles/descriptions, image alt text



* Turn our expertise into search-friendly content that sounds human (not AI spam)



* Coordinate a simple content calendar that supports both LinkedIn + SEO



6) Trade show marketing support (as needed)



* Pre-show + during + post-show content



* Simple handouts / signage concepts / recap posts / follow-up content



7) Reporting + improvement



* Monthly reporting and improvement plan:



* What worked, what didn’t, what to test next



* Focus on reach + engagement + inbound interest (not vanity only)



Expected output (baseline)



This may adjust, but typical targets:



* 2–4 LinkedIn posts per week



* 5–15 high-quality comments per day (or delivered in a daily batch for approval)



* 1–2 graphics/carousels per week



* 2–4 short videos per month (more around events)



* 2–4 SEO blog posts per month (topic length depends on keyword difficulty and intent)



Requirements (Non-negotiable)



* Strong English writing (US business tone, clear, confident, not fluffy)



* Proven LinkedIn content experience (portfolio required)



* Graphic design skills (portfolio required)



* Video editing ability (examples required)



* Can work independently and proactively



* Reliable communication + consistent delivery



SEO experience (BIG PLUS)



* SEO experience is a major advantage. If you have SEO experience, please mention:



* Tools you’ve used (Ahrefs, Semrush, Surfer, Google Search Console, GA4, etc.)



* Examples of blog posts that ranked or increased traffic/leads



* Your process for keyword research + content outlines + on-page SEO



Tools (Preferred)



* Canva/Adobe, CapCut/Premiere/DaVinci, Google Drive, Trello/Asana, basic analytics.

SEO tools are a plus (Search Console / GA4 / Ahrefs / Semrush / Surfer).



IMPORTANT: How to apply (filters out time-wasters)



If you do not follow these instructions, you will NOT be considered.



* Send ONE application message with:



* Portfolio links (LinkedIn work + design + video + blog/SEO if available)



* A short summary of your best results (LinkedIn and/or SEO):



* starting point, what you did, what improved (reach, engagement, followers, traffic, rankings, inbound, etc.)



Answer these questions (copy/paste and reply under each):



* What hours can you work? Can you overlap 30–60 mins with US Eastern Time a few days/week?



* What tools do you use for design and video? What SEO tools (if any)?



* How do you get content out of a busy CEO with limited time?



* Required mini-sample task (must include):



* Write 3 LinkedIn posts for OpSec (choose any topics below)



* Write 5 example comments you would leave on posts in my network (IT, healthcare, SNF admins, construction, security)



* Write 1 SEO blog outline (H1/H2/H3) for one topic below, including 8–12 keyword ideas



Choose any topics for the LinkedIn posts:



* "Top 3 technology failures we see in skilled nursing facilities (and how to prevent them)”



* “What SNFs misunderstand about access control / delayed egress compliance”



* “Why nurse call reliability matters more than features”



“* How to plan low-voltage + IT together during a facility renovation”



Blog outline topic ideas (choose one):



* “Skilled Nursing Facility Access Control: What Administrators Need to Know”



* “Nurse Call System Reliability: Preventing Downtime in SNFs”



* “Wander Management Systems: Compliance, Safety, and Best Practices”



* “5 Security Upgrades That Reduce Risk in Nursing Homes”



First line of your application must be: OpSec + LinkedIn

(Applications without this will be ignored.)

title: Product Researcher - Ecommerce / Dropshipping - FB Ads
description:
We run multiple direct-to-consumer eCommerce brands and are looking for a sharp, detail-oriented researcher to help us discover new product opportunities by scanning the
 Ad Library.



This is a simple, focused role. You will search the
 Ad Library for brands that are actively running a high volume of ads (100+ active ads), confirm they sell a physical product, and log them into a Google Sheet. That’s the core of the job.



The business owner reviews your list weekly and d
 what to pursue. Your job is volume and accuracy.



What You’ll Do

• Search the
 Ad Library using keyword lists we provide (and that you’ll expand over time)

• Find brands running 100 or more active ads that sell physical products

• Log each qualifying brand into a Google Sheet with: brand name,
 Ad Library link, landing page URL, number of active ads, country, and niche category

• Ensure no duplicates in the sheet

• Skip brands that sell products on our avoid list (we’ll provide this)

• Deliver a minimum of 100 new qualifying brands per week



That’s It



There are no reports to write. No analysis to do. No recommendations to make. You search, you count ads, you log links. The simpler you keep it, the better you’ll perform in this role.



Schedule & Hours

• Part-time: 5-10 hours per week

• Flexible schedule — work whenever suits you, as long as the sheet is updated by end of day Friday each week

• No meetings. No calls. You receive instructions via a shared Google Doc and deliver via the Google Sheet.



Compensation

• Up to $150 USD per month (part-time, 5-10 hours/week)

• Paid monthly via direct bank transfer

• Potential to grow into additional research tasks (competitor analysis, ad creative analysis) at higher pay if you perform well



Requirements

• You have a
 account and can access the
 Ad Library (
/ads/library)

• Reliable internet connection

• Comfortable using Google Sheets (basic — you’re entering data into rows, not building formulas)

• Detail-oriented — links must work, ad counts must be accurate, no duplicates

• Self-motivated — nobody will check on you daily. You either deliver 40 brands on Friday or you don’t.

• Basic understanding of eCommerce (you know what a "landing page" is, you can tell the difference between a physical product and a digital course)

Nice to Have (Not Required)

• Experience with eCommerce, dropshipping, or online retail

• Familiarity with
 advertising or the Ad Library

• Interest in direct-to-consumer brands or online marketing

How to Apply

IMPORTANT: Applications that do not follow these instructions will be immediately rejected.

To apply, send a message that includes ALL of the following:

1. Start your message with the words "AD LIBRARY" so we know you read this entire posting.

2. Go to 
/ads/library right now. Search for any brand selling a physical product that has 100+ active ads. Tell me: the brand name, roughly how many active ads they have, and what product they sell. This should take you 5 minutes.

3. A link to the brand’s Ad Library page (not a single ad — the full brand page).

4. Your available hours per week and what days you’d typically do this work.

5. Your expected monthly pay in USD.

We’re hiring quickly. Shortlisted candidates will do a 1-day paid trial ($20 USD) before we confirm the role.

?

title: Growth Marketing Specialist – Paid Ads (Google & Meta)
description:
About Surface Labs



Surface Labs is a Y Combinator-backed applied AI lab building the Lead Operations Center for B2B marketing teams. Backed by Garry Tan, Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of HubSpot), and the CEO of AngelList — our AI agents have helped drive $40M+ in inbound pipeline and process 50K+ leads monthly for customers.



We unify lead capture, qualification, routing, follow-ups, and nurture so B2B marketers spend 80% less time on manual ops and more time converting leads into revenue.



The Role

We're hiring a Paid Ads Specialist to own and scale our Google and Meta ad campaigns. You'll work directly with the founding team to drive qualified inbound pipeline through paid channels — building, testing, and optimizing campaigns that convert.

This is a high-ownership role with real visibility. If you're sharp and results-driven, there's a clear path to a senior growth role as we scale.



What You'll Do



> Build, manage, and optimize Google Search, Display, and Meta 
/Instagram) ad campaigns end-to-end

> Own performance: monitor spend, CPC, CPL, ROAS, and conversion metrics daily

> Run structured A/B tests on ad copy, creatives, audiences, and landing pages

> Collaborate with the team on landing page optimization and conversion rate improvements

> Maintain clean campaign structure, tracking, and reporting (UTMs, attribution, dashboards)

> Identify new opportunities across paid channels to drive pipeline growth



You're a Fit If You...



> Have 2–4 years of hands-on experience managing Google Ads and Meta Ads — B2B SaaS experience is a strong plus

> Have managed budgets of $5K+/month and can show results (CPL, pipeline, ROAS)

> Understand the B2B buyer journey and how paid fits into a full-funnel strategy

> Are comfortable working async and independently with a US-based founding team

> Are data-driven: you live in Google Analytics, Ads Manager, and spreadsheets

> Have experience with tracking setup (Google Tag Manager, pixel implementation, conversion events)



Nice To Haves

> Experience with HubSpot, Clay, or similar GTM tools

> Familiarity with LinkedIn Ads

> Interest in AI tools and using them to work faster and smarter

> Experience with landing page tools (Webflow, Framer, etc)



Why Join Surface Labs



> Work directly with a YC-backed founding team on a category-defining product

> High ownership and real impact — your work directly drives company revenue

> Competitive compensation for the Philippines market + performance upside

> Remote-first, async-friendly culture

> Opportunity to grow into a senior or lead role as the company scales

title: Virtual Assistant - IT Service Provider
description:
Employment Type: Part-time (with potential to transition to full-time)

Schedule: 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM Central Time



About the Role



We're seeking a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support our U.S.-based IT service provider operations. This is a part-time position starting at 20 hours per week (4 hours per day, Monday-Friday), with strong potential to transition to full-time as the business grows. This is a non-technical role focused on administrative support, client communication, and operational tasks. While you won't be performing technical IT work, familiarity with technology and basic IT terminology will help you succeed in this position.



Key Responsibilities



Administrative Support

• Manage calendars, schedule appointments, and coordinate meetings

• Handle
 correspondence and phone communications with U.S.-based clients

• Prepare reports (Word/Excel), presentations (PowerPoint), and documentation

• Organize and maintain digital files and records

• Process invoices, purchase orders, and expense reports



Client Support

• Serve as first point of contact for client inquiries (non-technical)

• Log and track support tickets in our ticketing system

• Follow up with clients on project updates and service requests

• Coordinate onboarding processes for new clients

• Send service reminders and follow-up communications



Operations Support

• Assist with vendor coordination and procurement

• Help maintain documentation and standard operating procedures

• Track project milestones and deadlines

• Coordinate with technical tea
mbers on scheduling

• Support marketing efforts (social media, newsletters, content scheduling)



Required Qualifications

• 1+ years of virtual assistant or administrative experience (international/U.S. clients preferred)

• Excellent English proficiency - both written and spoken

• Strong organizational and time management abilities

• Able to work consistently during 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM Central Time (10:00 PM - 2:00 AM Philippine Time)

• Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace

• Comfortable using project management tools (e.g., Asana, 
, ClickUp)

• Self-motivated with ability to work independently

• Reliable, working computer with minimum specifications:

          - Processor: Intel i3 or equivalent (or better)

          - RAM: 8GB minimum

          - Stable high-speed internet connection (minimum 10 Mbps)

          - Dedicated, quiet workspace



Preferred Qualifications

• Previous experience supporting U.S. or international clients

• Experience in an MSP, IT company, or tech environment

• Familiarity with IT terminology and basic concepts

• Experience with PSA tools (SyncroPSA, Autotask, HaloPSA, etc.)

• Knowledge of CRM systems (High Level)

• Basic understanding of IT service workflows and ticketing systems

• Experience with documentation platforms (e.g., IT Glue, Hudu)



Skills & Attributes

• Exceptional attention to detail

• Proactive problem-solver

• Professional phone and
 etiquette with U.S. clients

• Ability to handle confidential information

• Adaptable and quick learner

• Team player with positive attitude

• Cultural awareness and ability to work with American business practices



What We Offer

• Health insurance

• 13th-month bonus

• Part-time position with clear path to full-time as business grows

• Stable, long-term remote work opportunity

• Professional development and training

• Supportive team culture

• Work with a growing U.S.-based IT company



Application Requirements

Worksite Requirements

• A fast-running computer with at least 8GB RAM and i3 processor

• Ability to connect to virtual desktop in the US (we will help with this)

• Reliable internet connection with at least 10mbps download and upload speeds

• A mobile phone with application usage capabilities

• A quiet, secure work room or office



Why You’ll Love Working Here

• Join a high-performing, collaborative team that values our people first.

• Work with modern technologies in dynamic cloud and hybrid environments.

• Access to mentorship, and professional development support.

• A culture that values character, a servant attitude, and enjoyable work.



How We Work

We believe great technology comes from great people - those who care about doing things the right way, not just the fast way. You’ll have the freedom to take ownership of your work, contribute ideas, and build solutions that last. If you’re driven by serving clients, security, and continuous learning, you’ll feel right at home here.



Our Core Values

People First - We realize we service people not computers.

Good in the Clubhouse - We work to make everyone around us better by being collaborative, humble, teachable, happy to teach, and accountable.

Flexible - We overcome obstacles. We can work outside of a checklist. We are able to adjust on the fly.

Trustworthy - We realize every interaction either builds or erodes trust. We choose to build.

Friendly - We’re happy to help, it’s in our name. We treat each other and our clients with good humor, although we take our work seriously, we don’t take ourselves too seriously.



Application Process

NOTE: Everything listed below must be provided to be considered for this position.

1 – Confirm you have experience in managing Microsoft 365.

2 – Upload your resume.

3 – Submit a short video of you in the area where you will conduct your work and on the computer you will use. *** You must mention “Amicus IT” in your video. ***

4 – In your short video, discuss the following:

> A. Previous experience

> B. Previous experience with Microsoft 365, PSA (ticket system) + RMM, CRM

> C. Confirm you’re able to work 9:00-1:00 GMT -5/6 Monday through Friday.

> D. What monthly rate you are seeking (USD)

5 – Submit all materials only through Onlinejobs.ph (no
 submissions)

title: Data Analyst (SQL & Python)
description:
Data Analyst (SQL & Python)



Salary: $2,100 USD Monthly

Location:  Remote

Schedule: Monday – Friday, 8 AM – 5 PM CT (Night shift in the Philippines)



Role Overview:



We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Analyst to own critical data workflows for a leading US-based media agency. This role is perfect for a technical professional who thrives on data integrity and has a natural curiosity to "dig" into complex datasets.

You will be responsible for manual data collection and processing, ensuring that reporting and business decision-making are supported by accurate, high-quality data. Beyond the technical tasks, you will collaborate with the Analytics team to simplify complex data issues and maintain a deep understanding of business processes end-to-end.



Key Responsibilities:



- Perform manual data collection and processing across multiple platforms to ensure accuracy and consistency.

- Create and modify reporting dashboards to support internal and client needs.

- Execute QA on data workflows and datasets to ensure total data integrity.

- Provide operational support to the Analytics team as workload increases.

- Proactively communicate with managers regarding priorities and deadlines.

- Document processes to maintain version control for all data assets.



Qualifications:



- Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.

- Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data-focused role.



Technical Skills:



- High proficiency in Excel, SQL, and Python.

- Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.

- Strong technical aptitude for working with large, structured datasets.



Soft Skills:



- Naturally curious with a strong desire to problem-solve and investigate data issues.

- Highly detail-oriented with a focus on validating work for accuracy.

- Ability to explain complex data issues to non-technical stakeholders in simple terms.

- Structured approach to prioritization and meeting fast-approaching deadlines.



Success Milestones:



- 3 Months: Fully onboarded to all data workflows and producing accurate work with minimal revisions.

- 6 Months: Independently owning entire workflows from beginning to end.

- 12 Months: Deep understanding of the business structure and contributing to new data and technology initiatives.



Work Requirements:



- Strong written and verbal English communication skills.

- Quiet, professional home workspace.

- Stable internet with a backup solution.

- Headset for meetings and coordination calls.



Benefits:



- Paid Vacation, Holiday & Sick Leave (after probation period).

- Bi-Monthly, tax-free payroll via Wise.

- Dedicated Workspark support and leadership guidance.

- Opportunity to work with a high-impact team on national TV and streaming campaigns.



Application Instructions:



- Apply using this link: 

- Required: Include a short voice or video recording introducing yourself. Highlight your experience with SQL and Python, share a brief example of how you’ve solved a complex data problem, and tell us why you are a "naturally analytical" thinker.



**Applications without a voice/video intro will not be reviewed.**

title: Operations & Talent Lead
description:
Operations & Talent Lead



Location: Remote 

Hours:  8:00am - 5:00pm or 9:00am - 6:00pm EST 

Compensation: $2,000 USD / Month 



Role Overview:



As the Operations & Talent Lead, you are the bridge between technical excellence and a thriving remote culture. Your goal is to ensure our 
 ecosystem is a well-oiled machine while simultaneously ensuring our remote team feels supported, heard, and empowered through high-empathy leadership. You are the "Right Hand" to the COO, responsible for the harmony of our people and our processes.



Key Responsibilities:



1. People Success & Team Rapport

- Daily Pulse Checks: Conduct daily 1:1 "check-ins" to build genuine relationships, identify roadblocks, and ensure every tea
mber feels supported.

- Culture Stewardship: Foster a culture of transparency and trust, identifying signs of burnout or misalignment before they become issues.

- AI-Enhanced Recruitment: Lead the recruitment lifecycle, using AI tools to screen resumes against benchmarks and conducting first-round "culture-fit" interviews.

- Interview Coordination: Manage interview scheduling for the COO via Google Calendar, acting as the professional first point of contact for all candidates.



2. Operations & Automation Architecture

- 
 Mastery: Build and optimize complex boards, advanced automations, and cross-board dependencies.

- Reporting & Data Visualization: Transform raw data into clean, client-ready visual dashboards using 
, Excel, and Google Sheets.

- Process Documentation: Create and maintain structured SOPs and filing systems (Google Drive) to ensure operational cohesion.

- Workflow Optimization: Continuously audit systems to identify friction points and implement AI-driven solutions to increase team efficiency.



Technical & Professional Requirements:



- Emotional Intelligence (EQ): Exceptional active listening skills and the ability to handle sensitive team dynamics with care and confidentiality.

- 
 Power User: Deep experience in building automation logic and high-level dashboards.

- Reporting Expert: High proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (Pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and advanced data cleaning).

- AI Literacy: Comfortable leveraging LLMs (ChatGPT/Gemini) to summarize data, draft communications, and optimize screening workflows.

- Communication: Strong written and verbal English with a professional, "calm" presence.



Technical Setup:



- Workspace: A quiet, professional home office with a noise-canceling headset.

- Redundancy: Stable internet with a reliable backup and a power backup solution (generator or high-capacity power station).



Benefits:



- Payroll: Bi-monthly tax-free payroll via Wise.

- Time Off: Paid vacation, holiday, and sick leave after probation.

- Growth: A long-term, stable role with direct mentorship from the COO and opportunities for increased responsibility.



How to Apply:



- Follow this link:  

- Please be prepared to include a video or voice sample introducing yourself. Your recording MUST follow this structure:

1 - Start with the exact phrase: "I am the Operations & Talent Lead you are looking for."

2 - Briefly describe a 
 automation or dashboard you built that solved a major business problem.

3 - Tell us about a time you had to deliver difficult feedback to a tea
mber or manage a conflict. How did you maintain the relationship while solving the problem?

title: Performance Marketing Executive (B2B & E-commerce)

Dolphy Australia is a rapidly growing supplier of commercial washroom accessories and hotel amenities across Australia and the Pacific. We partner with procurement managers, hotel chains, builders, and facility managers to deliver reliable, commercial-grade solutions.



We are building a modern revenue engine where marketing is accountable for pipeline, efficiency, and growth — not vanity metrics.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer (FDE) – Client Operations
description:
Forward Deployed Engineer (FDE) – Client Operations

Location: Remote – Philippines

Employment Type: Full-time

Reports to: Founder



About Velocity Voice

Velocity Voice is a conversational AI-powered dialing platform processing 500,000+ calls per day for enterprise insurance clients. We help carriers and agencies scale their outbound operations with intelligent dialing, AMD optimization, and real-time analytics.



The Role

We're hiring a Forward Deployed Engineer to own the technical success of our managed services clients. You'll be embedded in client accounts—managing lead flow, optimizing dialer performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring campaigns hit their numbers. This isn't traditional support. You'll be part engineer, part strategist, part operator.

The goal: transition clients from self-service onto committed contracts where we take the wheel and deliver results.



What You'll Do



Own end-to-end performance for a portfolio of client accounts on managed service contracts

Configure and optimize dialer campaigns—pacing, AMD settings, retry logic, time-of-day routing

Manage lead ingestion, list hygiene, and segmentation to maximize contact rates

Monitor real-time dashboards and proactively fix issues before clients notice

Work with APIs to build integrations, pull data, and automate workflows

Analyze campaign performance and recommend optimizations (connect rates, conversion, cost per contact)

Serve as the primary technical point of contact—fielding questions, troubleshooting, and training clients

Document processes and build playbooks for scaling the managed services function

Collaborate with engineering on product feedback and feature requests from the field





What We're Looking For



2-4 years in a technical customer-facing role (solutions engineer, technical CSM, support engineer, or similar)

Comfortable working with APIs—can read documentation, make requests, debug integrations

Strong analytical chops—you can look at campaign data and know what levers to pull

Experience with telephony, dialers, or contact center operations is a major plus

Fast learner who can pick up new systems and figure things out independently

Excellent written and verbal English—you'll be on calls and Slack with US-based clients

Process-oriented but scrappy—can build structure while moving fast

Available for overlap with US business hours (at least 4-5 hours daily)





Nice to Have



Experience with insurance lead generation (ACA, Medicare, Final Expense)

Familiarity with FreeSWITCH, VoIP, or SIP

SQL or basic scripting ability

Background in performance marketing or lead gen operations



Why Join Juiced?

You'll get deep exposure to cutting-edge dialing and AI infrastructure while working directly with a strong lead who will train and mentor you. This role has clear upward mobility — top performers will take on more ownership, coach new hires, and potentially move into team lead positions as we scale.



Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience. This is a high-impact role with room to grow as we scale the managed services business.



To Apply

Send a brief note on why you're a fit and include examples of technical problems you've solved for clients.

title: SEO Content Writer
description:
*must use 15 apply points to be considered. 



We’re a US-based digital marketing agency specializing in SEO, Google Ads, and
 Ads for clients in the construction, security, and real estate industries. We’re looking for a dedicated SEO content writer to join our team and focus on writing pillar pages and city/location pages for our clients.

You will work directly alongside our senior content writer, Janice, who handles blog production. Together, you’ll execute a content strategy built around topical authority — pillar pages that establish our clients as the go-to resource in their industry, supported by city/location pages that capture local search traffic.

This is not a blogging role. You will be writing long-form, strategically structured content that serves as the foundation of each client’s SEO strategy.



What You’ll Be Writing

Pillar Pages (3,500–5,000 words)

These are comprehensive, authoritative guides on a client’s core topics. Examples: “The Complete Guide to Mobile Surveillance for Construction Sites” or “Everything You Need to Know About Selling Your House for Cash in Houston.” Each pillar page must be thorough enough that Google sees it as the definitive resource on the topic.

City/Location Pages (800–1,200 words)

These target specific service areas for our clients. Examples: “Pergolas and Pavilions in [City, State]” or “Cash Home Buyers in [Neighborhood], Houston.” Each page must be unique — not templated content with the city name swapped out. We need genuine, locally relevant content that ranks.



Your Day-to-Day

 ? Receive content briefs from our SEO strategist that include target keywords, keyword hierarchy, internal linking instructions, and content structure

 ? Use Search Atlas Content Genius to generate initial drafts, then edit and enhance them to publish-ready quality

 ? Coordinate with Janice to ensure pillar pages and blogs are properly linked and support each other within the content cluster

 ? Follow our pillar page framework: direct-answer lead sections, comparison content, supporting data, and clear internal linking to cluster blogs

 ? Deliver content that scores well in Search Atlas’s SEO content scoring

 



Tools You’ll Use

 ? Search Atlas — Content Genius for drafting, topical maps for content planning, SEO scoring for optimization

 ? Google Docs — Content drafts and collaboration

 ? Slack — Team communication



        •.      
 — task management 



 ? Loom — Training and async walkthroughs



Requirements

Must-Have:

 ? Strong English writing skills — native-level grammar, spelling, and sentence structure (writing samples required)

 ? At least 2 years of experience writing SEO content (blogs, service pages, or location pages)

 ? Understanding of on-page SEO: keyword placement, header structure, meta descriptions, internal linking

 ? Ability to write long-form content (3,000–5,000 words) that is comprehensive, well-organized, and not fluff

 ? Comfortable working with AI writing tools as a starting point, then editing and improving the output — not just publishing AI drafts as-is

 ? Reliable internet connection and available during US business hours (at least 4–5 hours of overlap)

Nice-to-Have:

 ? Experience writing for construction, home services, security, or real estate industries

 ? Familiarity with Search Atlas, Ahrefs, or similar SEO platforms

 ? Understanding of topical authority, content clusters, and pillar page strategy

 ? Experience with RankMath or Yoast for on-page SEO optimization

 ? Familiarity with WordPress publishing



What Makes This Role Different

You won’t be churning out generic blog posts. You’ll be building the strategic content foundation that drives rankings for real businesses. You’ll have a clear content strategy, structured briefs, and the tools to do great work. You’ll collaborate closely with a senior writer who knows the clients well and can help you get up to speed quickly.



We value quality over volume. We’d rather you write one exceptional pillar page than three mediocre ones.



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:

 1. Two writing samples — ideally long-form SEO content (pillar pages, guides, or service area pages). Blog posts are okay if you don’t have pillar page samples, but let us know.

 2. A short note (3–5 sentences) explaining how you approach writing a pillar page from scratch. What’s your process?.

title: Long-Form AI Video Editor + AI Storytelling Producer (Character Consistency)
description:
Type: Contract / Part-time (room to grow into full-time)



Remote: Yes



Start: ASAP



Tools: We provide the AI tools and accounts



(IMPORTANT: MUST SUBMIT A PORTFOLIO OF AI WORKS)



About the Role



We’re hiring a long-form AI video storyteller who can produce narrative-driven videos using AI generation tools and strong editing instincts. This role is NOT short-form reels—it’s for long-form storytelling (target 10–15 minute videos: YouTube-length narratives, episodic content, cinematic sequences).



You should be able to create videos that feel cohesive and intentional: consistent characters, consistent environments, consistent visual style, and strong pacing from start to finish.



We provide access to the AI tools. What we need from you is craft, taste, and storytelling and proven experience making AI-generated video content. We will provide all scripts for the projects.





What You’ll Do

- Produce long-form AI videos from concept to final export (with our direction).



- Maintain character consistency across scenes (face, body, wardrobe, style, mannerisms).



- Maintain visual consistency (lighting, color palette, camera language, environment continuity).



- Build scenes using AI tools and refine outputs until they match the story requirements.



- Assemble full edits: pacing, transitions, music, sound design, dialogue/VO, SFX.



- Work with our provided scripts and elevate them through visuals and editing choices.



- Create and manage a repeatable workflow for episodes (templates, style bibles, prompt systems).



- Organize assets and versions cleanly for handoffs and future iterations.





Key Skills We Need (Must-Have)



Long-form storytelling editing(structure, tension, payoffs, emotional rhythm).



Strong understanding of cinematic language (shots, continuity, pacing, coverage).



Proven ability to create and maintain:

- Consistent characters

-Consistent art direction

-Consistent locations / world-building



Experience with AI video generation pipelines and iteration workflows.



Clean workflow habits (file organization, naming, version control mindset).





AI Experience (What Your Portfolio Should Demonstrate)



We’re specifically looking for creators who already have AI projects showing:



Character continuity across multiple scenes.



Style consistency across an entire video (or episode).



Cohesive world-building (settings, props, clothing, time of day).



Ability to troubleshoot AI artifacts and keep quality high.



We do not require any specific AI toolssince we’ll provide the stack—what matters is that you understand the workflow and can execute.



Editing Tools



Premiere / DaVinci / After Effects (any is fine).



Strong audio skills are a big plus (dialogue clarity, music mixing, SFX layers).



Bonus: experience building pipelines (asset libraries, prompt libraries, shot lists).





What Success Looks Like



You can take a script/outline and deliver a cohesive long-form AI video.



Characters stay recognizable and stable from scene to scene.



Visuals feel like one connected world — not random AI clips stitched together.



The final video feels intentional, emotional, and watchable all the way through.

----------------------------------------------------

What to Send When Applying (Required)



Portfolio links (AI long-form preferred).



1–2 examples that specifically show character consistency across multiple scenes.



A short breakdown of your workflow (how you keep characters/visuals consistent).



Your rate (per minute of finished video OR per project) and weekly availability.



Bonus: Include a short “breakdown reel” showing prompts, iterations, and before/after improvements.





Nice-to-Haves



Episodic storytelling experience (series structure).



Shot listing / storyboarding ability.



Prompt systems / “style bible” creation.



Team collaboration (taking notes, iterating quickly, meeting deadlines).

title: Level 1 IT Support and Security Technician – Managed Services Provider
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a part-time (to start) Level 1 Technician to join our Managed Services team. You’ll play a key role in delivering exceptional technology outcomes for clients across industries—from professional services to manufacturing.

This role is for someone who thrives in complex environments, enjoys solving challenging problems, and takes pride in the work provided.



What You’ll Do

• Microsoft Management – Provide Level 1 support in Microsoft, including resetting passwords, reinstalling Microsoft Office Apps, and general issue troubleshooting.

• Google Workspace - Provide Level 1 support in Microsoft, including resetting passwords and general issue troubleshooting.

• Develop and execute automation scripts using SyncroPSA, PowerShell, and Power Automate.

• Review security checklists for compliance.

• Pull data from various systems for monthly reports.

• Review and test backups periodically.



What You Bring – Areas of Experience

• 1+ years of hands-on experience in an MSP or multi-tenant IT environment.

• Microsoft 365 – Administration, EntraID, Intune (including autopilot and scripting), and Office Apps.

•
 security, DNS management

• Strong working knowledge of SyncroPSA/RMM tools preferred.

• RMM/PowerShell scripting

• A mindset for continuous improvement.

• Excellent English communication skills—both written and spoken.

• A sense of ownership, professionalism, and pride in every task.



Schedule

• Part-time role (to start) supporting 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM CT (GMT -5/6) time zone

• Monday through Friday.



Worksite Requirements

• A fast-running computer with at least 8GB RAM and i5 processor

• Ability to connect to virtual desktop in the US (we will help with this)

• Reliable internet connection with at least 100mbps download and upload speeds

• A mobile phone with application usage capabilities

• A quiet, secure work room or office



Benefits

• 13th month annual bonus

• Health insurance



Why You’ll Love Working Here

• Join a high-performing, collaborative team that values our people first.

• Work with modern technologies in dynamic cloud and hybrid environments.

• Access to mentorship, and professional development support.

• A culture that values character, a servant attitude, and enjoyable work.



How We Work

We believe great technology comes from great people - those who care about doing things the right way, not just the fast way. You’ll have the freedom to take ownership of your work, contribute ideas, and build solutions that last. If you’re driven by serving clients, security, and continuous learning, you’ll feel right at home here.



Our Core Values

People First - We realize we service people not computers.

Good in the Clubhouse - We work to make everyone around us better by being collaborative, humble, teachable, happy to teach, and accountable.

Flexible - We overcome obstacles. We can work outside of a checklist. We are able to adjust on the fly.

Trustworthy - We realize every interaction either builds or erodes trust. We choose to build.

Friendly - We’re happy to help, it’s in our name. We treat each other and our clients with good humor, although we take our work seriously, we don’t take ourselves too seriously.



Application Process

NOTE: Everything listed below must be provided to be considered for this position.



1 – Confirm you have experience in managing Microsoft 365.



2 – Upload your resume.



3 – Submit a short video of you in the area where you will conduct your work and on the computer you will use. ***You must mention “Amicus IT” in your video.***



4 – In your short video, discuss the following:

> A. Previous MSP experience

> B. Previous experience with Microsoft 365, Entra ID, Azure, PSA (ticket system) + RMM, scripting, PowerShell

> C. Confirm you’re able to work 9:00-1:00 GMT -5/6 Monday through Friday.

> D. What monthly rate you are seeking (USD)



5 – Submit all materials only through Onlinejobs.ph (no
 submissions)

title: Founding AI Engineer / Applied AI Architect — Build Frontier AI Systems for a Real Estate Operation
description:
I’m hiring a top-level AI specialist to help me push AI deep into a real estate wholesaling business — think AI-native operations, agentic systems, and custom tooling.



Important: I already have standard automations in place. I’m not hiring for basic GoHighLevel workflows, Zapier, or “prompt engineering.” I want someone who is actively building with the newest AI capabilities and can turn them into real, reliable business systems.



What you’ll do

You’ll function like an AI systems architect + builder, working directly with me to identify high-leverage automation opportunities and then ship:



Agentic workflows that can plan, take actions, and complete multi-step tasks with tool-use



Custom AI operators that connect to CRMs/APIs, can read/write data safely, and handle edge cases



AI decision systems for lead triage, prioritization, routing, and next-best-action logic



Knowledge/RAG systems that reliably use internal SOPs, past conversations, docs, deal notes (no hallucination mess)



Evaluation + reliability: guardrails, testing harnesses, monitoring, human-in-the-loop fallback, audit logs



Automation at scale: robust orchestration, queues, retries, observability, and cost control



Examples of “big wins” we might build



An AI “deal desk” that reviews a lead and outputs: motivation score, recommended offer strategy, risk flags, follow-up plan, and dispo angle



A negotiation assistant that adapts tone + strategy per seller profile (without sounding like a bot)



A pipeline agent that pulls property/market data, summarizes, flags anomalies, and creates a one-page investment memo



A “dispo optimizer” that ranks buyers, customizes outreach, predicts likelihood to close, and manages follow-ups automatically



A compliance-safe messaging brain that stays consistent across SMS/email/calls and learns from outcomes



What makes you a fit (must-have)



You’ve built real AI systems in production (agents, tool-use, orchestration, RAG, evals)



You keep up with new releases and can explain what matters and what’s hype



You think in terms of systems, failure modes, and measurable outcomes



You can build fast without shipping fragile prototypes



Strong preference for people who can show



Tool-using agents (function calling / actions) with reliability patterns



Evals (unit tests for prompts/agents, regression testing, offline eval sets, A/B frameworks)



Observability (logs, traces, cost metrics, fallbacks)



Clean architecture + pragmatic engineering judgment



Tech profile (flexible, but this is the level)



Python/TypeScript, APIs, databases, background jobs/queues



Agent orchestration (LangGraph / custom orchestrators / similar)



RAG with good retrieval discipline (chunking, reranking, citations, grounded outputs)



Experience deploying + operating systems (Docker/cloud optional but helpful)



Nice-to-have



Voice AI / telephony agents



Real estate domain knowledge (not required)



Security/compliance mindset for customer communications and data handling



Engagement



Start with a paid, high-impact pilot: 1 system that meaningfully moves revenue or reduces labor



If it’s a fit: ongoing role as my long-term AI build partner (or part-time “AI lead”)



You’ll have autonomy, direct access to decision-making, and a backlog of high-value projects



Compensation



Premium rates for premium talent. Hourly or project-based.



Long-term upside for the right person.



Apply (read carefully — this is how I screen)



Send one message with:



2–3 proof examples of AI systems you personally built (GitHub, Loom, case study, screenshots)



A short paragraph: what you built + what results improved (speed, cost, conversion, revenue, etc.)



Your view on: “Agents in production — what actually works today and why?” (5–10 sentences)



Your proposed first 2-week plan for finding and shipping one AI system with measurable ROI in a real business



Do NOT apply if:



Your experience is mostly GHL/Zapier-style automation



You can’t show real implementations



You only do “prompt packs” or chatbot scripts without tool-use + reliability



Subject / first line: “Founding AI Engineer — [Your Name]”

title: Client Experience & CRM Operations Specialist
description:
Client Experience & Growth Operations



Position Summary

The Client Experience & Growth Operations Specialist owns all non-clinical patient communication systems and CRM-driven workflows.



This role is responsible for ensuring every patient inquiry, new lead, onboarding step, follow-up, and automation trigger is managed accurately and efficiently.



The Specialist proactively reduces staff workload, strengthens patient retention, improves conversion rates, and eliminates communication breakdowns through structured workflow ownership and automation.



To confirm you read this entire job description, please begin your application with the word:

“Growth.”

This role is both operational and growth-focused, ensuring systems are not only maintained but continuously improved.



The ultimate goal is to create a seamless, organized, and responsive patient experience while freeing up providers and staff from communication overload and manual follow-up tasks.



Core Responsibilities

Communication Channel Ownership

Own and manage all non-clinical communication within:

Spruce

OptiMantra messaging

CR
ssaging platforms (GoHighLevel)



Daily responsibilities include:

Monitoring Spruce and OptiMantra throughout business hours

Responding to routine patient inquiries

Routing clinical messages appropriately

Ensuring no message remains unresolved

Tracking open conversations

Confirming appointments and visit readiness

Messaging missed lab patients

Following up on incomplete sign-ups



Outcome:

Zero dropped communication threads.



Lead & Conversion Management

Own the full lifecycle of new leads.

Daily responsibilities include:

Monitoring new lead submissions

Entering and tagging leads correctly in CRM

Placing leads into appropriate workflows

Ensuring contact within 24 hours

Following up on unbooked leads

Tracking introductory visit conversion rates



Outcome:

Improved conversion and zero untracked leads.



Onboarding Completion Oversight

Ensure new patients complete all required steps before their visit.

Responsibilities:

Monitoring incomplete intake forms

Following up on missing consents

Confirming payment methods on file

Ensuring labs are ordered or scheduled

Escalating incomplete charts to Patient Care VA



Outcome:

Reduced last-minute scrambling and improved visit readiness.



CRM & Automation Development

Build, maintain, and optimize automated workflows.

Responsibilities:

Building
 workflows

Mapping onboarding sequences

Creating re-engagement campaigns

Managing nurture sequences

Testing automation logic

Cleaning and organizing contact lists

Monitoring funnel performance

Reporting on lead conversion



Outcome:

Reduced manual follow-up and measurable growth improvement.



Systems & Workflow Improvement

Actively identify and reduce operational friction.

Responsibilities:

Reviewing communication bottlenecks

Identifying repetitive manual tasks

Recommending automation opportunities

Documenting workflows

Updating SOPs

Submitting monthly improvement recommendations



Outcome:

Continuous operational efficiency gains.



In your application, please include:

A short paragraph explaining how you would organize 50 unread patient messages in Spruce.

One example of an automation or workflow you have personally built and what problem it solved.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
SUMMARY



We are seeking a Social Media Manager who will be responsible for creating content and developing strategies that drive creator growth and brand impact. This role combines creativity with data-driven decision-making, crafting engaging content, optimizing influencer collaborations, and supporting creators to grow their audience and influence.



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Plan, launch, and optimize influencer marketing campaigns across specific assigned social media platforms

- Collaborate with internal teams to align influencer initiatives with brand campaigns, product and launches

- Track, measure, and report campaign performance using key metrics such as reach, engagement, conversions, and ROI.

- Stay updated on social media trends, platform updates, and emerging creators to keep campaigns fresh and competitive.

- Experiment with new formats (e.g., livestreams, co-branded content, affiliate partnerships) to drive growth and engagement.



QUALIFICATIONS



- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- PREFERRED: 2+ years of experience in social media management, influencer coordination, or content scheduling

- Familiar with posting and scheduling on social media

- Quick learner who follows instructions well

- Highly organized and able to manage multiple accounts simultaneously

- Strong communication and teamwork skills

This role is for a proactive individual who can handle both the technical side (Shopify deployment) and the creative side (YouTube/TikTok automation). We have the custom code and high-end designs ready—we need you to bring them to life and manage the daily operations.

"Owner mindset"—you don't just follow tasks, you suggest improvements to drive sales.

title: Youtube & Short-form Editor for Podcasts
description:
At TBC Studios we've landed every podcast we've ever produced on the top charts ... but that's not why people choose to work with us.



When done right, podcasts have the power to change someone's life ... they're the friend that keeps you company on your drive to work, the mentor that teaches you a new skill or the pep talk you need to take that next step forward. 



TBC Studios is where sound meets strategy, every show we produce is backed by psychology & marketing tactics to ensure it lands in the ears of those who need it most. 



Because the right person behind the mic, can change everything. 



You’ll also be working across our creative sibling Project C Studios is Brisbane's newest podcast and content studio, built by podcasters ... for podcasters and located just off James Street.



After booking hundreds of studio sessions for ourselves and our clients we could never find the studio we wanted ... so we built it.



Our studio is designed to be fully customisable to suit your brand and aesthetic and our priority is to always make you look, feel and sound your best.







The Role:



We’ve been growing quickly, and so have our shows. We design all of our shows as if we are creating a brand, we know who we’re trying to talk to and what they need to hear. 



This is not the same video editing roles you've seen published on seek.



We don't want you to 'cut clips together'



We want you to be able to tell stories through the videos you create.



If you are obsessed with reverse engineering hooks, want to create content that actually makes a difference and helps people through a really tough day, gives them the pep talk they need for a big life change or even the skill they've been trying to master - we do this ... and more.



We are growing FAST on Youtube, TikTok and Instagram so you must have experience with this platform, thumbnails, titles and testing here.





What you'll Actually Do:



Build channel strategies for our clients incorporating their podcasts and ensuring this aligns with overall brand and content strategy



End to end management of selected channels and strategic recommendations for client owned channels



Creating edits for Youtube Shorts, Tiktok and Instagram for our clients using podcast footage



Providing feedback and guidance for clients on videography setup and additional trends to incorporate Identifying ways to constantly innovate and ensure these videos and audiograms stand out across each platform. Complete end to end long form edits for Youtube including thumbnail creation



You'll thrive in this role if you:



Have incredible attention to detail



Are extremely organised



Are obsessed with TikTok and IG, and already creating content for yourself or others



Are proactive, take initiative and are a naturally fast learner



Genuinely care about the success of your clients, your team and creating work that you are proud of



Always want to stay ahead of the curve and find ways to innovate and stand out



Set high standards for yourself and love a fast paced environment



Have worked with founders or personal brands in the past (or would love to)



Are a reliable, fast and clear communicator







You'll need:



Proven experience editing Reels/TikToks (must include examples with captions, transitions, B-roll)



Strong graphic design skills



To understand marketing psychology or be willing to quickly upskill and learn in this area



Comfortable using tools like CapCut, Final Cut, Premiere Pro, After Effects and InDesign



An eye for trends and coming up with new ideas



Why you’ll love it here:



An opportunity where your work can genuinely impact the lives of others. We get messages daily telling us “this was exactly what I needed to hear”, “thank you so much for putting this out there” & “this is the push I needed to make a change” 



You’ll have full ownership of campaigns end to end and the ability to directly see the growth of the podcast, community and brand 



You'll be paid to listen and learn from some of the most incredible minds in the lifestyle, business, property, coaching and crypto world (no boring convos over here)



You’ll be surrounded by a team of smart and driven creatives who genuinely care - about their work, their clients, and each other.



We invest in people who take ownership and initiative and in return, we back you with mentorship, feedback, and room to grow.



We are looking for someone for 20-40 hours with an immediate start but we are happy to be flexible and extend more or less hours for the right person





If this sounds like you please apply here

We run a dropshipping business targeting multiple EU countries (Germany as primary market, plus France, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, and other EU markets) and need a skilled storyteller and video editor who can create compelling advertisement content across various European languages. You'll combine creative video editing with market research to produce high-converting ads for diverse EU audiences.



What You'll Do

Add voiceovers, subtitles, and text overlays in German, French, Italian, Spanish, Dutch, etc.

Research competitor ads and successful campaigns across EU markets

Use AI tools (Claude, ElevenLabs) for translation and voiceover assistance in multiple languages

Ensure smooth narrative flow and cultural relevance for diverse EU audiences



Required Skills

Strong storytelling abilities - can craft compelling narratives from raw footage

Additional EU languages - French, Italian, Spanish, Dutch (huge bonus!)

Experience with animations, graphics, and sound design

Research skills for multi-market competitor analysis

Proficiency with AI translation and voiceover tools for multiple languages



Compensation & Schedule



$4-7 per hour based on experience and quality

20-35 hours per week

Weekly payments

Potential for raises based on performance



To Apply Please Include:

Availability & Setup - Your weekly availability, timezone, and technical setup (software, hardware, internet speed)

Rate Expectations - Your expected hourly rate within our $4-6 range based on your experience level

title: Video Editor – Twitch VOD to YouTube Highlights (Part-Time / Remote)
description:
About the Role: 

We're looking for a skilled and reliable video editor to help us repurpose Twitch livestream VODs into polished, engaging YouTube videos. You'll be cutting long-form streams (typically 2–4 hours) down into tightly edited highlight videos between 15–25* minutes in length. This is a great opportunity for someone who understands streaming content and has a strong sense of pacing and storytelling.



What You'll Do:

Watch through Twitch VODs and identify the best moments (funny clips, big plays, exciting discussions, etc.)

Cut and assemble footage into a cohesive 15–25* minute YouTube video

Add basic photo overlays or captions as needed

Sync and clean up audio where necessary

Export videos as an .MP4 and deliver files on schedule

Communicate clearly on timelines and flag any issues early



Requirements:

Proven experience editing video content (portfolio or sample edits)

Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, CapCut or similar software

Strong understanding of pacing, you know when to cut and what to leave out

Reliable internet connection for downloading large VOD files

Ability to meet deadlines consistently

Good communication in English



Nice to Have:

Familiarity with Twitch, YouTube, and music/streaming culture

Experience with motion graphics or sound design

Experience editing long-form content into short-form highlights



Work Details:

Remote / Work from home (No Timezone Restrictions)

Gig work to start (with potential to grow to Part-time based on output quality and volume)

1-3 video per week

Pay: $7 per hour



How to Apply:

Please send the following:



A short introduction about yourself and your editing experience

2–3 samples of previous video edits (YouTube links preferred)

Your availability

title: Motion Graphics Specialist (On-Demand / Project-Based)
description:
Motion Graphics Specialist (On-Demand / Project-Based)



We’re looking for a skilled motion graphics specialist to support a growing media team on a project-by-project basis.



This is not a full-time role. Instead, you’ll be brought in when our editing team needs help executing specific motion graphics, animations, or visual effects that go beyond standard editing.



You’ll be working alongside a team producing content across multiple YouTube channels, including long-form videos and short-form content with a focus on storytelling and retention.



What You’ll Do

• Create custom motion graphics, animations, and visual effects (typically 15 seconds or less)

• Collaborate with our editing team to bring specific ideas to life

• Step in when a project requires higher-level motion design

• Deliver clean, polished assets that integrate seamlessly into existing edits



What We’re Looking For

• Strong experience with motion graphics (After Effects or similar)

• Ability to execute clean, modern, and engaging visual effects

• Strong communication and ability to understand creative direction quickly

• Reliability and fast turnaround on short tasks



This Role is Ideal For Someone Who:

• Enjoys freelance or flexible, project-based work

• Has strong motion graphics skills but doesn’t want full-time editing work

• Can quickly jump in, execute, and deliver without needing heavy oversight



How to Apply (Read Carefully)



To be considered, you must follow these instructions:



Use the word “San Andres” in the subject line of your application



Include a direct link to a video showcasing motion graphics or visual effects that you personally created



Provide the following:

• Your typical cost for creating a 15-second (or less) motion graphic/effect

• Your typical turnaround time for that type of project



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.



Additional Info

This is a long-term, on-call opportunity. Strong performers may be consistently brought in for future projects as our team and content continue to grow.



If you’re confident in your motion graphics skills and can deliver high-quality work quickly, we’d like to see what you can do.

munity posting, replies, simple content creation, and tracking. This is execution-heavy. You’ll use my templates first, then help create new angles over time.

 Groups etiquette (no spam)

TOOLS:

-
 (groups + page)

IMPORTANT: VERIFIED SIGNUPS 

A signup counts as “verified” only if:

 is confirmed (double opt-in OR confirmed via confirmation
 click), AND

.

munity or page posting experience (links if available)

title: AI Creator – TV Video & Generative Media
description:
Role: AI Creator – TV Video & Generative Media



Salary: $3,200 USD Monthly

Location:  Remote

Schedule: Monday – Friday, U.S. Business Hours 



Role Overview: 



We are seeking an AI-first creator to join a specialized group of engineers and creatives at a leading U.S. TV advertising agency. Our client believes TV is the most powerful marketing channel, but they’ve rebuilt the agency model to make it more efficient and scalable.



This role is for a technical artist who doesn't just "generate" content but knows how to bridge the gap between interesting AI experiments and professional, broadcast-quality work. You will be responsible for producing high-end visuals for national TV campaigns, blending cutting-edge generative tools with traditional editing to deliver polished, "shippable" results.



Key Responsibilities: 



- Produce high-end AI content using generative tools to create unique visuals and video for national TV campaigns.

- Blend AI-generated footage with traditional tools (Premiere/After Effects) to deliver polished, broadcast-ready assets.

- Experiment relentlessly by being the first to test new models and finding ways to push creative boundaries.

- Move fluidly from initial concept to the final cut, owning the creative process throughout.

- Proactively solve technical hurdles in the "messy middle" of new tool adoption.



Qualifications: 



- *Proven portfolio showing intentional, high-fidelity AI visuals, not just raw generations.*

- Mindset: A "Rebel Against Ordinary" who is hungry, humble, and driven by relentless learning.



Technical Skills: 



- * Mastery of Generative AI tools such as Midjourney, Runway, Luma Dream Machine, Veo, Sora, Kling, Pika, etc.*

- Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Premiere and After Effects.

- Model-agnostic approach with a clear point of view on which tool is best for specific creative tasks.

- Strong technical aptitude for "hacking" new tools to achieve specific, intentional results.



Soft Skills: 



- Naturally curious with a creative eye for what is truly "ready to ship".

- Calm confidence when facing challenges and the ability to pivot quickly.

- Team-oriented mindset ("Team is Hero") that prioritizes collective success over individual ego.

- Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to work without a manual.



Work Requirements: 



- Strong written and verbal English communication skills.

- Quiet, professional home workspace.

- Stable internet with a backup solution.

- Headset for meetings and coordination calls.



Benefits: 



- Paid Vacation, Holiday & Sick Leave (after probation period).

- Bi-Monthly, tax-free payroll via Wise.

- Dedicated Workspark support and leadership guidance.

- Opportunity to work with a high-impact team on national TV and streaming campaigns.



Application Instructions: 



Apply using this link: 

You will need to include a link to your portfolio and a short voice or video recording introducing yourself highlighting your favorite AI workflow, share a brief example of a "messy" creative problem you solved with AI, and tell us why you are "AI-obsessed".



**Applications without a portfolio and voice/video intro will not be reviewed.**

title: Customer Support Manager Ecommerce
description:
We are looking for a Customer Support Manager to oversee our growing Customer Support Team for our online store. This is a long-term role with real responsibility. You will be the main point of contact for our support agents and ensure that all customer inquiries are handled efficiently, accurately, and with the highest level of professionalism.



Your main responsibilities will include:



Acting as the first point of contact for our customer support team when they have questions or need assistance.



Learning our products, workflows, and support templates thoroughly in order to guide the team.



Training and onboarding new support agents as our team grows.



Reviewing and managing all return requests:



Support agents will add return cases to a shared list.



You will verify them, approve or reject requests, and process refunds to customers.



Monitoring support performance to ensure speed, accuracy, and quality of responses.



Helping improve our templates and processes over time to increase efficiency.



Escalating issues to management when needed and keeping communication clear.



Leadership Requirements:

We need someone who has already managed a team in the past. This is not an entry-level role. You must be confident in leading people, making decisions, and showing authority.



When mistakes happen, you identify the root cause, fix them immediately, and ensure they never happen again.



You think ahead, work proactively, and keep the team focused on solutions instead of excuses.



You show power, discipline, and leadership – the team must trust and follow you.



Future responsibilities may include:



Scheduling shifts and ensuring full coverage across the week (including weekends).



Creating performance reports and KPIs for the support team.



Handling exceptional or high-priority customer cases directly.



What we expect from you:



Proven experience in customer support management, e-commerce service, or team leadership.



Strong organizational and communication skills.



Ability to train and coach tea ---------- mbers effectively.



High level of responsibility, trustworthiness, and attention to detail.



Good English communication (German is not required – translations and templates are provided).



Proactivity: You don’t just react, you solve problems and improve processes.



Why this role is important:

You will ensure that our support team runs smoothly and that customers always get fast, professional, and accurate solutions. By managing returns and refunds carefully, you also protect the company from mistakes and keep customers happy.

title: Bookkeeper for HVAC, Plumbing and Electrical Companies
description:
We are a U.S.-based fractional CFO firm serving growing HVAC, plumbing, and electrical companies. We are hiring a strong bookkeeper to support our CFO work. This is not a full-charge role. You will not manage clients independently. Your job is to keep the books clean, accurate, and accrual-based so the CFO can provide high-level guidance.



This is an after-the-fact accounting role. Clean up, reconcile, document, and prepare reliable financials.



**Must Have Experience**



* 3+ years of U.S. bookkeeping or accounting experience

* Daily QuickBooks Online usage

* Strong accrual accounting knowledge

* Confident balance sheet reconciliations

* Payroll journal entries and allocations

* Clear understanding of COGS vs operating expenses

* Experience with HVAC, plumbing, or electrical companies required

* ServiceTitan experience is a strong bonus

* Experience supporting multiple clients inside a firm environment preferred

* Reliable high-speed internet



**What You’ll Do**



* Maintain clean accrual-based books in QuickBooks Online

* Reconcile bank and credit card accounts monthly

* Review and post payroll entries properly

* Keep the chart of accounts structured and consistent

* Identify errors, inconsistencies, and unusual activity

* Prepare financials for monthly CFO review



**Schedule**

Monday through Friday, East Coast USA business hours, non-negotiable.



**To Apply**



Submit:



* A resume link (Google Drive or Dropbox)

* Confirmation you can work East Coast hours

* Confirmation of 3+ years U.S. accounting experience

* Brief note describing your experience with HVAC, plumbing, or electrical clients



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

title: DIRECT RESPONSE EDITOR For 7-Figure Supplement Brand
description:
WE ARE HIRING VIDEO EDITORS. If you're not ready to move fast, this isn't for you.

We're a 7-figure/year supplement brand that is growing every single month. We need editors who already know what it takes to create ads that actually convert , not people who "want to learn ecom." You should already have experience editing for ecommerce brands, specifically in the supplement or beauty space. That's non-negotiable.



Here's what we need from you:

?? You know AI tools and you're not afraid of them. ElevenLabs, Kling, Veo3, HeyGen, Nano Banana / text-to-image prompting , if you're already using these, you're ahead of the pack. If you're not using all of them yet but you're the type of person who learns new tools in a weekend, we want to talk.



?? You've edited ads for ecommerce brands before. Supplement brands, beauty brands, DTC health brands , you've been in this world and you understand what makes a scroll-stopping ad. This is a hard requirement. We're not training someone from zero on what an ecom ad looks like.



?? You get work done fast. We're talking 1-2 batches of ads per day, delivered within 24 hours of receiving a brief. A batch might be one full ad. It might be one ad with three hooks. Depends on the brief. Point is , you execute, you don't sit on things.



?? You communicate fast on WhatsApp. This is how we operate. You see a message, you respond. Simple.



?? You are FLUENT in English. This is a requirement, not a preference. If you also speak Spanish, that's a bonus.



?? You're coachable. This is the most important thing on this list. We have systems, we have training videos, we have courses, we have a way of doing things that works. In the beginning, you're going to need a lot of coaching , and that's fine. We don't judge questions here. Ask them. But after your trial phase, you need to be able to run independently without someone holding your hand on every single task. You know when to ask and you know when to execute.



?? You're comfortable with how we operate. We hire fast and we fire fast. If you're great, you're going to be heavily incentivized and you're going to grow with a brand that's scaling aggressively. If it's not working, we're not going to drag it out for months , it's better for both of us to figure that out quickly and move on. No hard feelings, no wasted time.



?? You genuinely want to get better every single day. This isn't a "clock in, do the bare minimum, clock out" situation. We're building something here. If you want to be part of a team that's constantly pushing, constantly improving, and constantly winning , apply. If you just want a gig, don't.



TO APPLY, send us your portfolio with examples of ecommerce ads you've edited (supplement or beauty preferred), the AI tools you currently use, and your WhatsApp number. If you don't have ecom ad examples, don't apply.

Who is this role for? You MUST have previously worked as a Level 2 Case Manager at Airbnb. Do not apply if you have no Airbnb experience.

Please clearly mention in your
:

- Your Airbnb-related experience

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant is not required, but it is a plus. If you have VA experience, please describe the company and your responsibilities.



What does this job include?

- Talking to guests: Respond promptly to guest messages and inquiries, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and prompt resolution of any issues.

- Airbnb Cases, Reviews & Claims: Monitor and manage Airbnb cases and guest reviews, including removing invalid or untrue negative reviews and handling claims or guest charges for broken, damaged, stained, or missing items.

- Operations Coordination (Cleaners, Supplies & Maintenance): Coordinate with cleaners on supply ordering and Amazon deliveries, and communicate with handymen and the project coordinator to ensure maintenance issues are addressed in a timely manner.

- Invoice & Document Management: Cross-check cleaning invoices against the Airbnb calendar to ensure accurate billing, and organize all receipts and invoices into designated Google Drive folders for proper record-keeping.

- Prospect List Building: Create and maintain prospect lists of short-term rental owners using defined internal criteria.

- Prospect Research & Enrichment: Add basic background details to prospect lists (number of listings, pricing range, reviews, etc.) to support sales outreach.

- Follow-Up List Management: Maintain organized follow-up lists for prospects requiring future outreach. Please include the word Apples to your subject line to prove you’ve read the job post.

- Social Media Research (Non-Creative): Identify high-performing Airbnb, short-term rental, and real estate social media videos, save links, and note simple, observable patterns such as topic, hook style, or format.

- Operations-Based Content Ideas: Pull recurring guest or operational issues fro
ssage logs and note them down for the team to use when creating content.

title: Bookkeeper
description:
About the Role:



Dash Rentals is a high-growth, urban-rooted company that operates on strict SOPs and direct leadership. We are seeking a "Numbers Pro" who treats financial records as a fortress. You won't just be "doing the books"—you will be the guardian of our financial integrity across multiple entities, including car rentals and coaching. We don’t micromanage, but we have zero tolerance for missed details or late reporting.



Responsibilities:

- Full-Cycle Recording: Accurately log all income and expenses for rentals, coaching, and separate business entities with 100% audit-readiness.

- System Management: Maintain QuickBooks Online with precision, ensuring every transaction is categorized according to our specific chart of accounts.

- Liability & Asset Tracking: Meticulously reconcile accounts, track security deposits, and monitor vehicle-specific profitability.

- Reporting: Prepare and deliver monthly Profit & Loss, Balance Sheets, and Cash Flow statements without being reminded.

- Digital Documentation: Maintain an obsessive level of organization within Dropbox and Asana; if a receipt isn't attached, the job isn't done.



Qualifications:

Experience: 2+ years of professional bookkeeping or accounting experience (Rental or Real Estate experience is a plus).

Technical Mastery: Expert-level proficiency in QuickBooks Online and Google Sheets/Excel.

Mindset: A professional who values speed, accuracy, and ownership over "staying busy."

Communication: Exceptional written English; you must be able to explain financial discrepancies clearly and concisely.



Compensation & Schedule:

Training Phase: $200–$250 bi-weekly (2–4 week intensive trial based on performance).

Post-Training: Significant pay increases and bonuses are awarded based on output and accuracy, not hours worked.

Work Hours: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST Monday through Friday

We value the ability to follow instructions. Failure to follow these steps will result in immediate disqualification:

1) Send your resume and a redacted sample of a monthly financial report you have prepared.

 subject line MUST be: Numbers Pro – [Your Name]
