title: Credit Repair Backend Specialist (FCRA / Dispute Processing / Compliance-Focused)
description:
IMPORTANT: READ BEFORE APPLYING



This is NOT a social media job.

This is NOT a customer service job.

This is NOT a sales job.



This role is strictly backend credit repair operations.

If you do not have experience working inside dispute workflows, compliance systems, and structured SOP environment, do not apply.



Role Overview

We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Credit Repair Backend Specialist to execute structured SOP based workflows inside our credit restoration system.

You will be responsible for:

 • Following Phase 0 – Phase 4 dispute workflows

 • Reviewing client credit reports

 • Identifying suppression layers (repos, charge offs, collections, etc.)

 • Preparing dispute letters based on FCRA guidelines

 • Tracking investigation timelines (30-day cycles)

 • Monitoring bureau responses

 • Updating client CRM status

 • Following compliance documentation procedures

You will NOT freestyle.

You will follow our exact SOP structure.



Responsibilities

 • Review client credit reports (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion)

 • Identify:

 • Charge offs

 • Repossessions

 • Late payment patterns

 • Hard inquiries

 • Mixed file indicators

 • Metro 2 compliance violations

 • Execute dispute rounds (Round 1, Round 2, Escalation)

 • Track 30 day legal investigation periods

 • Log bureau responses

 • Flag verification inconsistencies

 • Follow intake documentation checklist:

 • SSN verification

 • Passport/ID validation

 • Address consistency

 • Bank statement proof

 • Document all actions inside CRM

 • Maintain compliance documentation



Required Experience

You MUST have experience with:

 • FCRA knowledge

 • Credit dispute processing

 • Understanding of Metro 2 reporting

 • Bureau investigation timelines

 • Charge off vs Collection distinctions

 • Suppression layers in underwriting

 • Hard inquiry disputes

 • Compliance based credit repair (NOT illegal tactics)



Preferred:

 • Experience with DisputeFox, ScoreCEO, Client Dispute Manager, or similar

 • Understanding of EOSCAR system

 • Experience with U.S. credit bureaus



Skills Required

 • High attention to detail

 • Strong English writing (formal letter drafting)

 • Ability to follow SOP step by step

 • Organized documentation habits

 • Ability to analyze credit reports without missing negative accounts



We DO NOT Use:

 • CPNs

 • Identity theft fraud tactics

 • False claims

 • “Credit sweep hacks”

If you use illegal or unethical methods, do not apply.



Performance Metrics (KPIs)

 • Accuracy rate on dispute rounds

 • Zero missed negative accounts

 • On-time cycle tracking

 • Compliance adherence

 • Proper CRM documentation



Compensation

 • Based on experience

 • Long term opportunity

 • Growth into Operations Manager possible



How to Apply



Reply with:

 1. Your experience in credit repair backend work

 2. What is the FCRA 30 day investigation rule?

 3. What is a charge off vs a collection?

 4. Have you worked with Metro 2 reporting?

 5. What dispute software have you used?



Subject line must include:

“Backend NOVIRE Operator”

title: BRAND OPERATIONS ASSISTANT
description:
We are launching a premium ecommerce brand built on precision, restraint and elevated presentation. This is not a fast fashion project and it is not a short-term experiment. We are building a long-term brand with high standards and strong positioning.



We are looking for a highly organised and proactive Brand Operations Assistant to support daily operations, influencer coordination and customer communication. This role is execution-focused and requires consistency, attention to detail and clear written English.



Your primary responsibility will be ensuring that the operational side of the brand runs smoothly. You will manage customer
s and inquiries, provide timely and professional responses, handle order tracking issues, assist with returns processing and maintain clear internal records. Customer experience must reflect a premium standard at all times.



You will also manage influencer outreach and coordination. This includes researching creators that align with our aesthetic, initiating outreach via
 or social platforms, tracking responses, coordinating gifting logistics, ensuring content is delivered on time and maintaining organised spreadsheets of all partnerships.



In addition, you will assist with content scheduling across social platforms, uploading approved posts, organising received media files and monitoring comments or direct messages. You are not responsible for creative strategy or ad performance, but you must ensure execution is clean and consistent.



This role requires someone dependable, detail-oriented and able to work independently without constant supervision. You should be comfortable using spreadsheets, managing inboxes, tracking multiple conversations and following structured systems.



Strong written English is required. Previous experience in ecommerce support, influencer coordination or remote administrative roles is preferred. We value clarity, reliability and professionalism above everything else.



When applying, please provide examples of influencer profiles you believe match a refined, soft luxury aesthetic and explain why. Also describe how you would structure and track influencer outreach to ensure nothing is missed.

title: Data Entry
description:
Company Overview: Terrific Property Group

Terrific Property Group is a real estate investment firm specializing in the "wholesale" model of property acquisition. As defined in authoritative real estate literature, wholesaling involves identifying distressed properties, securing them under contract, and assigning those contracts to end-investors for an assignment fee. Our mission is to provide liquidity to homeowners in difficult situations while revitalizing local housing markets through strategic investment.

Position: Cold Caller & Data Entry Specialist

We are seeking a dedicated professional to join our acquisitions team. This role is fundamental to the "prospecting" phase of the real estate cycle, which requires consistent outreach to generate a steady "deal flow.The successful candidate will bridge the gap between raw data and actionable investment opportunities.

Primary Responsibilities

 • Outbound Prospecting: Conduct high-volume cold calling to property owners using provided lead lists. You will utilize "scripts" designed to build rapport and identify "motivated sellers"—those whose circumstances (such as probate, foreclosure, or property distress) necessitate a quick sale.

 • Lead Qualification: Assess the four pillars of a wholesale lead: Motivation, Timeline, Property Condition, and Price Expectation.

 • Data Management: Accurately input property details and owner information into our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.This includes updating "disposition" statuses to ensure the sales funnel remains organized.

 • Information Security: Maintain strict confidentiality regarding the financial and personal data of potential sellers, adhering to standard ethical practices in real estate brokerage and investment.

Qualifications and Requirements

 • Communication Skills: Proficiency in English with the ability to handle objections gracefully. In real estate, the "art of the deal" often begins with the ability to listen and empathize with the seller's unique situation.

 • Technical Proficiency: Experience with VOIP systems and data entry software. Candidates must have a reliable computer (Windows OS preferred) and a stable internet connection.

 • Resilience: The ability to maintain a high level of energy and professionalism throughout a shift, as cold calling is a numbers-driven activity where "conversion rates" are optimized through persistence.

Compensation and Schedule

 • Rate: 57.74 php per hour.

 • Payment Structure: As an Independent Contractor, you are responsible for your own local taxes and benefits.

 • Performance Incentives: Potential for bonuses based on the successful closing of deals generated from your leads.



Please reply with
 contact and WhatsApp phone number

- Quiet workspace

- Excellent english with no heavy accent

OR

$200 per signup (no hourly)

- Monthly performance bonuses



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

HOURS

- 2:00 AM – 6:00 AM Philippine Time



ONLY APPLY IF

title: Mid-term Rental Virtual Assistant

Virtual Assistant — Midterm Rental Operations (Remote)

title: eCommerce Advertorial Builder (Shopify + AI)
description:
Performance Marketing Agency | Supplement Brands

10–20 hrs/week to start | Long-term role



Who We Are



We are a performance marketing agency working with supplement brands.



Our focus is simple:

Turn cold paid traffic into profitable subscribers.



That means advertorials, product pages and checkout flows must convert.



We are looking for someone who can build end-to-end advertorial funnels inside Shopify using AI tools and move fast.



The Role



You will build full advertorial ? PDP ? checkout flows.



Not just design.

Not just copy.

Not just layout.



End-to-end execution.



You must be comfortable:



• Cloning high-performing advertorials

• Rebuilding and improving PDPs

• Structuring subscription-first layouts

• Increasing AOV via bundles and offer blocks

• Building advertorial ? PDP journeys

• Making fast CRO updates from feedback

• Shipping quickly without hand-holding



You will work from structured briefs and examples, but you must think for yourself.



Tools We Use



• Shopify

• Replo (preferred)

• GemPages or theme builders

• Subscription apps (Recharge, Skio, Appstle etc.)

• AI tools for copy and image generation

• Meta Ads Library for research



You must be comfortable using AI tools to:



• Draft advertorial copy

• Rewrite and improve competitor structures

• Generate supporting images if needed

• Source relevant images and testimonials

• Create comparison tables and visual blocks



What “Good” Looks Like



You can:



• Take a competitor advertorial and rebuild it cleaner and higher converting

• Structure belief-building for problem-aware buyers

• Build mobile-first, fast-loading pages

• Position subscription clearly and intelligently

• Implement bundles and upsell logic

• Think about conversion, not just aesthetics



If you only follow instructions step-by-step, this role is not for you.



We want someone who understands why pages convert.



Supplement Experience (Bonus)



Experience building for:



• Health brands

• Skincare

• Supplements

• Subscription brands



Is a big advantage.



You Must Be



• Fast

• Detail-oriented

• Comfortable with feedback

• Able to work independently

• Hungry to improve

• Available during UK hours overlap

title: Project Manager / Consultant – Higher Education
description:
• Reports to Senior Consultant, Governance & Compliance

• Client-facing role

• Excellent English (essential)

• Philippines-based, corporate leadership background preferred

• Critical thinker with proven problem-solving ability



About the role

 

We are looking for someone to join our International Team as a Project Manager / Consultant, Higher Education for our client projects. You will be working and collaborating with tea
mbers and the management team to work with clients, stakeholders and partners, and setup, track and drive project activities. No two projects are the same so you will be proficient at finding, gathering and presenting information from prior projects and tenders to present a professional response with a level of autonomy, intellect and problem-solving ability. 



You will also get the opportunity to be involved in the delivery of projects to drive and work on project activities with the consulting team and gain greater knowledge of the activities and develop your own skills and experience. This role has significant growth opportunity for the right person.



This is a full-time, 40 hours a week role based in the Philippines and can be performed from a home office. Reliable internet connection, strong English proficiency (written and verbal), and experience in stakeholder liaison and project management/coordination are vital for performing this role.

 

 

Some of the reasons why you should be a member of the DVE Team:



• Full-time, long-term contract

• Ability to work from home and not have to commute to and back from work

• Experience working with an Australian company

• Challenging and rewarding, with opportunities to progress and grow your role and career

• Work with a great team that supports you.

• HMO and leave benefits

• Opportunity to receive periodic coaching from senior tea
mbers

 

 

To be successful in this role, you need to be (selection criteria):



• Experienced in driving and managing the end-to-end projects with hard deadliness ensuring timely and successful submissions.

• Fluent in English as you will be the primary point of contact for clients, partners, and coordinating the work with our internal team. You should be able to effectively communicate requirements, timelines, etc.

• Experience managing bids and tenders is highly preferential.

• Organised and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You need to ensure that activities are tracking to plan and schedules, and deliverables submitted on time and on budget without sacrificing quality.

• Experience in driving project, where you can bring valuable experience 

• Able to roll their sleeves up and do the leg work in key project activities.

 

 

Other Requirements:

 

• A modern computer with minimum specs: i5 processor or equivalent, 8GB RAM (ideally 16GB), 250GB HD and must support and capable of running software used by DVE including Microsoft 365 suite, Microsoft Visio

• Fibre, DSL or Cable internet as your main internet connection (stable) with internet speed of at least 150Mbps

• A backup 4G/LTE/5G internet connection (could be a Wi-Fi dongle or pocket Wi-Fi)

• Conducive work environment and home office setup

• Chrome browser, Adobe Acrobat reader

• Genuine Windows OS installation - some internal software we use do not work with MacOS

• UPS/backup generator (preferred)

 

 

About DVE Solutions

 

DVE Business Solutions is a growing consulting company with a difference, led by South Australia Telstra Young Business Woman of the Year Jo Schneider. DVE clients are predominantly in the education sector with Universities and Higher Ed providers being core focus. With our communicative and collaborative methodology, DVE drives positive change that makes a difference in the areas of People, Process, Structure and Technology.



We work every day to change education from the inside out, and our work is underpinned by our core values - Work as OneTeam; Practice what we preach; Maintain client focus and; Enjoy what we do.

title: Remote US Tax Preparer & Bookkeeper (QuickBooks Online + Multi-State Sales Tax)
description:
We are a US-based company looking for a reliable, detail-oriented professional in the Philippines to join our remote finance team.

You will handle full-cycle bookkeeping in QuickBooks Online, prepare and file US sales tax returns for multiple states, and assist in preparing US individual and business tax returns.

This is a full-time remote position (40 hours per week). You must be able to work some US business hours (8am - 6pm Eastern Standard TIme - evening/night shift in Philippine time) so you can collaborate live with the US team.

Key Responsibilities:



Full-cycle bookkeeping and accounting in QuickBooks Online (transaction coding, bank & credit card reconciliations, monthly financial statements)

Prepare and file monthly/quarterly multi-state US sales tax returns (nexus tracking, returns, payments)

Prepare US individual tax returns (Form 1040, Schedule C, Schedule E, etc.) and small business returns

Issue and file 1099-NEC and 1099-MISC forms

Monthly and quarterly closings, account reconciliations, and financial reporting

Communicate daily with the US owner/CPA via Slack, Zoom, and



Requirements:



4+ years of experience handling US clients (bookkeeping + tax preparation required)

Strong experience with QuickBooks Online (must be comfortable as the primary bookkeeper)

Experience preparing and filing US sales tax returns for multiple states

Experience preparing US tax returns (1040, Schedule C, small business returns)

Excellent English communication (written and spoken)

Reliable high-speed internet and quiet workspace

Available a few days per week to work US time zone hours (approximately 8 PM – 5 AM Philippine time, with some flexibility)



Preferred (Big Advantage):



QuickBooks Online ProAdvisor certification (Core or Advanced)

Experience with ATX (CCH tax software) & TaxJar

Current or recent NBI Clearance



Compensation & Benefits:



$1,000 – $2,000 USD per month (depending on experience and speed/accuracy)

Annual performance bonus

13th-month pay equivalent

Paid Philippine holidays + US holidays

Long-term career growth opportunity (we promote from within)



How to Apply:

Please send your application with:



Updated resume (highlight US client experience)

Screenshot or link to your QuickBooks ProAdvisor dashboard (if certified)

Short cover letter answering: “How many years have you prepared US tax returns and filed sales tax for US clients?”



Only serious applicants with actual US tax + QuickBooks + sales tax experience will be considered. We will reply only to qualified candidates.

We look forward to working with you!

title: Customer Success Manager (Remote) – Marketing Agency | $600 + Performance Bonus ($1,500+/month potential)
description:
Customer Success Manager – Marketing Agency | $600 + Commission ($1,500+ Potential)



Hey — I’m Moe, founder of BYMOE Productions, a marketing agency based out of Boston. I built this company from scratch, went from $40K in debt to approaching seven figures in under a year, and now we serve ~40 local service businesses across the US. I’m not looking for someone who just wants a job. I’m looking for someone who wants to grow with me and eventually lead a team. If that’s you, keep reading.



?



About the Company



BYMOE Productions helps local service businesses — contractors, auto shops, med spas, moving companies, PT clinics — generate clients through Instagram advertising and DM automation systems. Our clients stay because we get them real results, not because they’re locked into contracts. That means client experience is everything to us.



?



The Role



You’ll be the primary point of contact for our clients after they onboard. Your job is to make sure every client feels supported, stays on track, and sees results. This is a relationship management role — not a sales role. You’ll be the person our clients trust, and the person I rely on to keep delivery running smoothly.



Day-to-day you’ll be responsible for:

 • Managing all client communication 
, Slack, text, Zoom calls)

 • Running and preparing for bi-monthly strategy check-in calls with US-based business owners

 • Tracking client progress, campaign performance, and deliverable timelines

 • Coordinating between clients and our internal team (video editors, ad managers, automation setup)

 • Managing onboarding workflows for new clients in Notion

 • Flagging at-risk clients early and proactively solving problems before they escalate

 • Maintaining and updating our project management systems (Notion, 
, Calendly)

 • Documenting SOPs and helping systematize our delivery processes as we scale



?



Compensation

 • $600/month base salary — paid on time, every time

 • Commission on client retention and upsells — structured so your earnings grow as you perform

 • Realistic total earnings: $1,500+/month for someone who takes ownership of the role



Commission examples:

 • Maintain a client retention rate above 90% for the month ? retention bonus

 • Successfully upsell a client to a higher service tier ? per-upsell bonus

 • Full commission structure shared with qualified candidates during the interview process



Payment via Wise or PayPal, your preference.



?



Who You Are

 • 1–2+ years in a client-facing role (account management, customer success, executive VA, or similar). Agency experience is a strong plus, but attitude and communication skills matter most.

 • Exceptional English — written AND spoken. You’ll be on Zoom calls with American business owners weekly. This is non-negotiable.

 • Highly organized and detail-oriented. Nothing falls through the cracks with you.

 • Proactive, not reactive. You anticipate problems before they become fires.

 • Comfortable with tools like Notion, Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom, and Calendly — or willing to learn fast.

 • Familiarity with digital marketing concepts (Meta ads, Instagram, funnels) is a plus but not required. We’ll train you on our systems.

 • Emotionally intelligent. You know how to manage a frustrated client, celebrate a win, and read between the lines.



?



Requirements

 • Reliable laptop/computer and headset with a microphone

 • Stable internet connection (minimum 25 Mbps)

 • Quiet workspace for client-facing Zoom calls

 • Available to work 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM US Eastern Time, Monday through Friday



?



Why Work With Us

 • Direct access to the founder. No middle management. Your ideas and contributions matter from day one.

 • Real growth path. This role has a clear trajectory to Team Lead or Operations Manager as we scale. I want to promote from within.

 • A company that’s actually growing. We’ve gone from 0 to ~40 clients in under a year and we’re just getting started.

 • We actually care about results. Our clients include businesses that have booked $1.2M+ in projects and achieved 6X return on ad spend through our systems. You’ll be part of something that works.

 • 13th month pay + PH holidays observed. We respect your time and culture.



?



How to Apply



Start your application with the word “BLUEPRINT” so I know you read the full listing. Applications that don’t include this will be skipped.



In your application, please include:

 1. A short intro — who you are, where you’re based, and why this role caught your eye

 2. Your relevant experience — specifically around managing client relationships or accounts

 3. Answer this question: “Describe a time you saved a client relationship that was at risk. What happened and what did you do?”

 4. BONUS (not required but will put you at the top of the list): A 2–3 minute Loom video introducing yourself



I review every application personally. If you’re the right fit, you’ll hear fro
 within 48 hours.



— Moe

title: Customer Service Agent for E-Commerce Brand
description:
Job Title: Customer Service Representative for E-Commerce Brand



Location: Remote



Base Pay per Month: $1,200

Performance Bonuses per Month: $300 - $1,000 (based on reaching certain KPI thresholds)

Total Possible Pay per Month: $2,200



About Us:

We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand dedicated to providing exceptional products and top-tier customer service. Our team is committed to delivering a seamless shopping experience for our customers while maintaining a fun, fast-paced, and customer-centric work environment.



As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled and empathetic Customer Service Representative to join our team and provide outstanding support to our customers.



Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly responsive and detail-oriented Customer Service Representative with a strong background in e-commerce support. The ideal candidate will excel in handling customer inquiries, resolving issues efficiently, and maintaining a high level of professionalism and empathy. If you have experience in customer service and a passion for helping people, we’d love to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:

- Provide excellent customer service via
, live chat, and social media platforms.

- Resolve customer inquiries related to orders, returns, refunds, shipping, and product details in a timely and professional manner.

- Work collaboratively with other departments (fulfillment, marketing, product teams) to ensure a smooth customer experience.

- Identify common customer issues and suggest improvements to optimize our service and reduce inquiries.

- Maintain and update internal documentation and FAQs for customer support efficiency.

- Process refunds, exchanges, and replacements according to company policies.

- Monitor and respond to customer feedback, reviews, and escalations to improve brand reputation.

- Use CRM and support ticketing systems to manage customer interactions effectively.

- (The password "DRAGON" to access the form.)



Key Traits and Abilities We’re Looking For:

- Customer-Centric Mindset: A strong commitment to providing excellent customer experiences and resolving issues effectively.

- Strong Communication Skills: Ability to convey information clearly, concisely, and professionally.

- Problem-Solving Mentality: Proactive in finding solutions to customer concerns and internal support challenges.

- Fast Response Time: Ability to manage and resolve inquiries quickly while maintaining high service quality.

- Tech-Savviness: Comfortable navigating e-commerce platforms, CRM systems, and communication tools.

- Attention to Detail: Ability to accurately process orders, refunds, and customer requests without errors.

- Emotional Intelligence: Able to empathize with frustrated customers and turn negative experiences into positive resolutions.

- E-Commerce Experience: Familiarity with online shopping, returns, shipping logistics, and customer support best practices.



Requirements:

- You MUST NOT have another job. We are looking for a candidate that can work FULL-TIME for us without another job's distraction.

- Minimum 2 years of customer service experience in an e-commerce setting.

- Fluent in written and spoken English with excellent grammar and communication skills.

- Ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently in a fast-paced, remote work environment.

title: E-Commerce Support & Listings Coordinator (Long Term Position)
description:
We are seeking a resilient, hard-working individual who is eager to grow with our company and progressively take on more responsibility. If you are motivated, detail-oriented, and ready to contribute to long-term success, this role is for you.

We are a fast-growing European e-commerce business selling premium niche products worldwide. This is a full-time, long-term role with strong advancement potential for someone reliable, proactive, and committed. This is not a simple check-in/check-out position — tasks must be completed accurately and fully before the workday ends. During onboarding and peak seasons, additional hours may occasionally be needed to meet business demands.



ROLE OVERVIEW

We are looking for a highly organized and detail-driven Virtual Assistant to handle the following responsibilities:

• Customer support: respond promptly and professionally to inquiries, resolve routine issues independently, and escalate complex cases when needed

• Product listing: upload and update products, verify specifications, format content, and ensure accuracy across platforms

• Supplier communication and issue resolution

• Production and pre-shipment tracking, including factory photo coordination and follow-up

• Competitor monitoring and reporting to identify opportunities and improvements



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

• Previous customer support experience

 • Reliable, consistent work ethic and ability to manage tasks independently

• Excellent communication: clear, structured, and professional

• Proactive problem-solver with strong initiative

• English proficiency at C1 level or above

• Fast and stable internet connection (150+ Mbps download and 80+ Mbps upload)

• Computer requirements: at least 16GB RAM to start, upgrade to 32GB RAM after hiring

• Dual-screen setup after hiring



Salary

• USD $450–$800/month, depending on experience

• Includes 13th-month pay



Hours

• 40 hours per week

• Minimum 6 hours daily overlap with European business hours



To Apply, submit the following:

• Your CV

• Computer specifications (CPU, RAM, workstation setup)

• IQ test result

• DISC personality profile

title: Part-Time YouTube Video Editor (AI Avatar | 8–9 Min Long-Form) Remote | $1,200 USD/Month | 3 Videos/Week | Long-Term
description:
About the Channel

The channel features a digital AI persona: Anya — The Imagineer.

She operates at the intersection of real estate and financial technology (Fin-Tech) — educating homeowners on how to use AI tools to sell their homes more strategically. No TikTok for this brand.

This is long-form authority content — clean, minimal, and professional.

It is educational and advisory, not entertainment-driven.

Tone:

Intelligent. Calm. Modern. Trustworthy. Advisory. Fin-Tech credible.

________________________________________

Who We're Looking For

We’re looking for a sharp, reliable editor who understands long-form pacing and can make an AI persona feel credible and authoritative on screen.

Scripts are fully provided. No research or scripting required. This is a structured, production-focused role with clear expectations and consistent workflow.

This starts at 3 videos per week. We start at 3 videos per week. As the channel scales to 4–6 videos per week, compensation scales proportionally.



Responsibilities`

Format provided scripts for AI avatar production in HeyGen. Generate AI avatar video inside HeyGen — training provided if needed. Edit 8–9 minute long-form YouTube videos with relevant B-roll, clean captions, and subtle motion graphics. Maintain professional pacing throughout. Deliver each video within 3 days of receiving the script. Submit final video for internal review before publishing.

________________________________________

What This Role Does NOT Include

No scripting. No SEO optimization. No thumbnail design. No analytics monitoring. No channel strategy. This is strictly a video production and editing role.

________________________________________

Requirements

Proven experience editing long-form YouTube videos (8+ minutes). Strong sense of pacing and viewer retention. Proficient in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci. Comfortable learning AI tools. Organized, deadline-driven, and self-managed.

________________________________________

Compensation

$1,200 USD/month

3 videos/week (part-time to start)

Compensation increases as weekly volume increases.

How to Apply

At the top of your application, write: IMAGINEER

Then include:

1. 2–3 long-form YouTube videos (8+ minutes) you personally edited — links only.

Do not provide short-form or TikTok-style samples.

2. Your proposed workflow from script receipt to final delivery.

3. What modification (if any) to this job description or workflow would make you confidently say “yes”.

4. What would be a deal-breaker for you in accepting this role?

title: Client Success Manager
description:
Client Success Manager – Marketd

Remote |(UK Hours)



Who We Are

We're a fast-growing AI and marketing agency helping home improvement companies scale through lead generation, CRM automation, and AI systems. We're not just running ads, we're building complete AI infrastructures for construction businesses, and we're moving fast.



Find out more about us here: 
/
/ www.marketd.ai





If the size of the challenge excites you rather than intimidates you, keep reading.



What You'll Be Doing

You'll own the client relationship from day one. This isn't an account management role where you send weekly update
s and call it a day. You'll be the person standing between us and lost revenue — and you'll know it.



Onboarding new clients and setting clear expectations from day one

Running regular check-in calls and holding clients accountable to the process

Managing a book of 15–20 accounts initially, growing as systems scale

Monitoring client performance inside GoHighLevel and flagging issues before they become problems

Building and refining SOPs to keep delivery consistent across all accounts

Working closely with our operations and automations team to improve delivery

Identifying upsell opportunities and passing them through to the sales team

Identifying process improvements to reduce manual work across the board



You'll be measured on:



Monthly client churn kept below 5%

Fortnightly check-in cadence maintained across every account

Client satisfaction and responsiveness

Upsell opportunities identified and flagged monthly





What We're Looking For



Excellent written and verbal communication — perfect English is non-negotiable

Quick to respond and proactive by nature

Obsessed with solving problems — you don't rest until something is fixed

Genuinely energised by big challenges and comfortable working at pace

A real interest in AI and automation — you should be excited about making your role more efficient as we scale, not resistant to it

Comfortable building and following SOPs to keep delivery tight as we grow

Highly organised with strong attention to detail

Hungry, driven, and someone who owns their numbers





Tools You'll Use Daily



GoHighLevel (CRM, pipeline management, automations)

Slack

Loom

Google Workspace

Notion


 / n8n (you don't need to build — but you need to understand what's possible)





Compensation and Growth

Base: $2,000/month

Performance bonus: Up to $500/month based on churn rate and upsell targets

Growth path: Clear trajectory to $3,000+/month within 6 months for the right person

Your role should pay for itself. If you keep clients retained and growing, we'll make sure you're rewarded for it. The people who come in early and perform will grow with the company.



This Role is NOT For You If:



You need hand-holding or constant direction

You treat problems as someone else's responsibility

You're looking for a quiet, predictable nine-to-five

You see "client success" as just sending friendly
s

You're not genuinely excited by AI and what it means for the future of this industry





Why Marketd

We move fast, we back our team, and we're building something serious. In the next 12 months we're scaling our client base significantly, launching new AI service lines, and expanding the team. The people who join now will be at the front of that.

The challenges here are real and the stakes are high — and that's exactly the point.



How to Apply

Record a 60-second Loom video introducing yourself, why this role interests you, and one example of a time you turned around a difficult client relationship. Start your application with the word GROWTH so we know you've read this in full.

Onboarding & Success

? Requirements

U.S.-based customers

???? How to Apply

title: Senior React Native Mobile Engineer (7+ Years Experience Required)
description:

7+ years building production React Native apps (not React, not hybrid, not Cordova)



Deep familiarity with Expo (managed + bare workflow), and Expo EAS build/deploy pipelines



Expert with both Xcode and Android Studio

Apple Developer Account setup



Certificates, provisioning profiles, entitlements



Uploading and managing builds in App Store Connect



Internal and external beta testing via TestFlight



App Store metadata and review process troubleshooting



Fully understand the Android ecosystem:



Google Play Console account setup



Creating signing keys and managing build variants



Managing tracks (internal, closed, open, production)



Uploading AABs, rollout strategies, Play Store policies



Strong JavaScript and TypeScript fundamentals (async flow, memory management, perf optimization)



Experience solving hard mobile problems like:



Background tasks



Push notifications (device-specific bugs? Welcome to hell)



Offline caching and syncing



Native SDK integration



UI jank / frame drops



Comfortable managing OTA updates, crash reports, CI/CD workflows, and OTA rollback strategies



???? Bonus Points For:

Working around Expo limitations with custom native code



Knowing what the React Native bridge is and how it becomes a bottleneck



Handling push notification weirdness across Samsung and Huawei devices



Building your own UI library instead of relying on bloated third-party components

How many years of React Native experience you have

title: PERFORMANCE MARKETING & CREATIVE LEAD
description:
We are launching a premium ecommerce brand built around precision, restraint and elevated presentation. This is not a fast fashion project and it is not a short-term dropshipping experiment. We are building a long-term brand asset with strong positioning and high standards.



We are looking for a performance-driven operator to take full ownership of paid media and creative testing from day one. You will be responsible for generating profitable revenue through structured campaign strategy and disciplined optimisation. You will not be micromanaged, but you will be measured on performance.



Your primary responsibility will be planning, launching and managing Meta/Google advertising campaigns. You must understand how to structure campaigns properly for ecommerce, how to test multiple creative angles at once, how to identify winning ads, and how to scale while protecting profitability. You should be confident working with budgets and making independent optimisation decisions based on real performance data.



In addition to managing paid traffic, you will oversee creative testing output. This includes developing weekly creative testing plans, identifying strong hooks and messaging angles, editing or briefing short-form video creatives, and continuously iterating based on data. You must understand that creative is the primary driver of performance and be capable of producing or coordinating consistent variations each week.



You will also be responsible for reporting. This includes tracking cost per acquisition, return on ad spend, conversion rate, click-through rate and overall profitability. A weekly written summary explaining performance insights and proposed improvements is required. You should be comfortable identifying problems before being asked.



Experience managing ecommerce accounts with real ad spend is required. You must understand how to test, scale and cut campaigns without emotional decision-making. Experience with Shopify brands is strongly preferred. TikTok advertising and Google Shopping experience are considered a bonus but are not mandatory.



Compensation will include a fixed base plus a performance-based bonus tied to profitability. We are looking for someone who wants to grow with a brand and be rewarded for results.



If you apply, please explain in detail how you would approach selling a limited first launch of 150 units within 30 days. We are looking for structured thinking, not generic answers.

title: Senior US Financial Negotiator (Mortgage / Debt Settlement / Retention Experience)
description:
Position Overview

***************

We are seeking a senior-level voice professional with experience handling U.S. homeowners in financial distress.



This role is similar to mortgage loss mitigation or debt settlement negotiation. It requires emotional composure, financial conversation skills, and disciplined communication.



This is NOT cold calling. This is structured negotiation with pre-qualified property owners.



We are looking for someone who is calm, analytical, and comfortable discussing hardship situations.



Who This Role Is NOT For

********************

• Script-based sales agents



• High-energy cold callers



• Commission-only closers



• Multi-job freelancers







We are looking for a stable professional.



Core Responsibilities

*****************

• Conduct scheduled calls with distressed U.S. property owners



• Assess financial and emotional resistance



• Navigate objections without pressure



• Guide conversations toward structured agreements



• Document clear call analysis







Required Background

******************

• 3+ years U.S. mortgage servicing, loss mitigation, or debt settlement



• Experience handling emotionally resistant U.S. customers



• Ability to discuss financial hardship professionally



• Clear, neutral American-facing accent



• Quiet home setup and professional environment







Strongly Preferred

***************

• Experience in major BPO firms handling U.S. mortgage accounts



• Team lead or senior CSR background



• Experience de-escalating distressed callers







Compensation

************

$18/hour



4 hours per day



Bonus: $400 per closed contract (No Limit)







High performers may transition to full-time.



Mandatory Application Step



Submit an unscripted voice recording answering:



1) “A homeowner says: ‘You investors are trying to steal my house.’ How do you respond?”

2) "I owe $10,000 in back taxes. I'll just pay it off next month"

3) "You're just trying to take advantage of me because I'm behind. I'm not desperate. I'll just let it go to auction."



Applications without recording will not be reviewed.

title: Looking for a new Home Buying Specialist to join our growing team!
description:
*** Please submit a video introduction along with your resume. Applicants without this will be disqualified. Thank you!***



*Remote Closer – Help NC Homeowners Solve Real Problems (Full-Time)**  

*Location: Remote / Based in NC preferred*  

*Base + Bonuses | Uncapped Earning Potential*  



Are you a confident closer who thrives on solving real problems and creating win-win deals?



Do you love connecting with people, hearing their stories, and helping them move forward with confidence?



If so, we want you on our team!!





About Us



We help North Carolina homeowners sell their homes *off-market*, without the stress of showings, fees, or repairs. We specialize in solving real-life challenges like:



- Inherited homes  

- Divorce situations  

- Foreclosure  

- Bad tenants  

- Homes that need serious repairs



We’ve built a reputation for honesty, speed, and making things simple for the seller. Now, we’re ready to grow—and we need a **rockstar sales rep** to help us get there.





Your Role



As our **Remote Closer**, you’ll speak with warm, qualified leads who have already shown interest. Your job is to:



- Listen to their story and understand their needs  

- Build rapport and gain trust  

- Make strong, fair offers that solve their problems  

- Put properties under contract  

- Follow up with consistency and empathy



This isn’t about pushing people—it’s about helping them!





You’re a Fit If You:



- Have 1–3+ years in sales (real estate, auto, insurance, solar, etc.)  

- Know how to control a sales conversation without being pushy  

- Are hungry to earn more and thrive in a performance-based role  

- Can follow a proven sales process and adapt on the fly  

- Are emotionally intelligent and can read between the lines  

- Are coachable, driven, and obsessed with growth



---



What You Get



- Base pay + bonuses!  

- Warm inbound leads—no cold calling  

- Proven scripts, systems, and coaching  

- Room to grow with our company!  

- The chance to truly help people and make a difference



Warning:



This role is not for you if you’re looking for easy money or just want to clock in and out. We move fast, hold high standards, and expect results.



But if you’re ready to grow your income, sharpen your sales skills, and build something real—we want to talk.



How to Apply



Send us your resume and a short video (2 min or less) telling us:  

Your work history & what attracted you to this role?



Let’s help more homeowners experience the *bright* side of selling!! Talk to you soon :)



*** Please submit a video introduction along with your resume. Applicants without this will be disqualified. Thank you!***

title: Transaction Coordinator - Fast-Growing Real Estate Company
description:
Are you highly organized, a great communicator, and thrive in a fast-paced environment? 



We’re a growing real estate wholesaling company looking for a driven Transaction Coordinator to join our team and help us reach our goals!



This is not a slow, sit-back-and-wait role. We close deals fast and we need someone who owns their pipeline, moves with urgency, and keeps every deal on track from contract to close.



What You’ll Do

 ? Manage active transactions from signed contract to closing

 ? Coordinate with sellers, buyers, attorneys, and title companies

 ? Conduct seller and buyer intro calls within 30 minutes of contract signing

 ? Perform weekly follow-ups with all parties on every active file

 ? Maintain accurate deal updates in our CRM (Podio)

 ? Identify problems before they become deal killers and bring solutions

 ? Support the disposition and marketing process as needed



You’re the Right Fit If You:

 ? Have experience in real estate, transaction coordination, or a related field

 ? Are extremely responsive — we operate on a 30-minute response standard

 ? Love being on the phone and are comfortable with persistent follow-up

 ? Are organized, detail-oriented, and thrive with systems and checklists

 ? Can work independently without being micromanaged

 ? Are available Monday–Friday 9:00am–6:00pm EST



Compensation

 ? $1,800/month base (paid weekly)

 ? Monthly team closing bonuses up to $1,000 additional 



Details

 ? 100% Remote

 ? Independent Contractor

 ? Full-time Monday–Friday

 ? Must have reliable internet and a quiet workspace



To Apply:

Please submit the following:

 1. Your resume

 2. A 1-2 minute video introduction — Tell us who you are, why you’re interested in this role, and what makes you a great fit. We want to see your personality and communication style. No scripts — just be yourself.





Submission instructions: Upload your video to Google Drive, Loom, or YouTube (unlisted) and include the link with your application.





Applications without a video will not be considered.

title: Creative Strategist DTC
description:
About the Role



We are a fast-scaling DTC beauty and skincare brand doing 6 figures per month, and we’re looking for a Creative Strategist to lead the development of high-performing ad concepts for Meta 
 & Instagram).



You will research, ideate, and create ad concepts that convert — using storytelling, emotional triggers, and proven direct-response principles.

Your goal is to turn insights into creative strategies that drive real sales and help scale the brand to the next level.



You’ll work directly with the founder and marketing team, with full creative freedom and support to test, learn, and grow.



Key Responsibilities



- Research the target audience and understand their emotions, desires, and motivations.

- Develop creative ad angles, hooks, and scripts that connect emotionally and convert.

- Write clear creative briefs for video editors and UGC creators.

- Review ad performance results and identify ideas for new tests or iterations.

- Collaborate with the team during weekly creative planning and performance calls.

- Keep creative assets organized and maintain a structured testing system.



What We’re Looking For



- Experience in creative strategy, ad scripting, or direct-response copywriting (beauty, skincare, or eCommerce is a plus).

- Strong understanding of direct-response advertising and emotional storytelling.

- Ability to interpret performance data and turn insights into actionable ideas.

- Skilled in writing hooks, short scripts, and creative briefs.

- Highly organized, consistent, and willing to improve through feedback.

- Excellent English communication skills.



Day-to-Day Tasks

- Create 4–6 new ad concepts per week (scripts, briefs, or iterations).

- Research audience insights and new emotional angles.

- Communicate with the founder and editors on upcoming creatives.

- Review ad performance and update creative documentation.

- Attend weekly strategy meetings via Zoom.



What Success Looks Like

- You consistently create ad concepts that generate profitable sales.

- You bring fresh ideas and emotional storylines that resonate with the audience.

- You turn data and feedback into new creative concepts.

- You take ownership of the creative system and help improve it over time.



How to Apply



Please send:

- A short introduction about your experience in creative strategy.

- 2–3 examples of ads, scripts, or campaigns you’ve created (Google Drive or portfolio link).

- Your expected monthly salary (USD).

- A short explanation of your process for coming up with new ad ideas.

Prioritize tests based on potential impact and effort

Collaborate with design, marketing, and content teams

Continuously improve conversion rates, AOV, and revenue

title: Dispositions Coordinator | Fast-Growing Real Estate Company
description:
Are you the person on the team who never lets anything fall through the cracks? 



Do you thrive on checklists, clean systems, and knowing exactly where every deal stands at all times? 



We’re looking for a detail-obsessed Dispositions Coordinator to manage our property pipeline from contract to close.



This is not a hardcore sales role. This is a process, communication, and execution role. We need someone who follows the system, keeps everything organized, and makes sure every deal moves forward on time — every single day.



What You’ll Do



Property Dispositions

 ? Market properties immediately after photos are received

 ? Send
 blasts, texts, and buyer communications for each new property

 ? Schedule buyer walkthroughs and coordinate with the transactions team

 ? Update all property statuses, buyer activity, and deal progress in Podio CRM

 ? Coordinate with the transactions team until every deal closes

 ? Follow up consistently to prevent delays and cancellations



Buyer Management

 ? Add a minimum of 10 new buyers or realtors to our database daily

 ? Maintain and update our VIP buyer list in Podio

 ? Follow up daily with active buyers on available and upcoming properties

 ? Verify buyer funding and ensure timely decision-making

 ? Keep all buyer profiles accurate and up to date



Comping

 ? Run property comps daily using Zillow, Redfin, and internal tools

 ? Verify ARV, exit percentages, and buyer profit spreads before marketing

 ? Enter all comp data into Podio accurately and on time

 ? Review comps weekly with leadership

Reporting & Communication

 ? Respond to all messages, calls, and
s within 10 minutes during work hours

 ? Submit a daily EOD report summarizing all activity

 ? Track weekly metrics — offers received, properties sold, days to sell, new buyers added

 ? Keep the entire team informed and updated without being asked



You’re the Right Fit If You:

 ? Are extremely organized and process-driven — you follow systems and improve them

 ? Are a clear, confident communicator on the phone and in writing

 ? Update your CRM after every single interaction without being reminded

 ? Can manage multiple active deals simultaneously without dropping the ball

 ? Hold yourself accountable — you don’t need to be chased to follow up

 ? Have experience in real estate, wholesaling, or a coordination/operations role

 ? Are available Monday–Friday during EST business hours



You Are NOT the Right Fit If You:

 ? Need constant direction to know what to do next

 ? Skip CRM updates or treat reporting as optional

 ? Get overwhelmed managing multiple priorities at once

 ? Treat follow-up as someone else’s job



Our Core Values

We are a faith-driven team that moves with speed and precision, communicates obsessively, treats everyone with kindness, and outworks everyone around us. If that resonates — you’ll love it here.



Compensation

 ? Competitive base salary (paid weekly)

 ? Monthly team closing bonuses

 ? Weekly bonus opportunities

 ? Real growth potential — we are scaling and promote from within



To Apply:



Submit the following:

 1. Your resume

 2. A 2–3 minute video introduction — Tell us who you are, your background, and why this role fits you. No scripts. Just be real.

 3. Answer this question in your video: “Walk me through how you would manage 10 active deals at the same time. How do you stay organized and make sure nothing slips?”





Upload your video to Loom, YouTube (unlisted), or Google Drive and include the link.





Applications without a video will not be considered.

title: Founding Operations Partner / Future Chief of Staff (US Tech Startup)
description:
Please watch Loom about the project.





If link doesn't appear, manually enter: loom dot com / share / 3f0a09caa61845dc8e6a65598ef724b9



Hi, I'm Jack. I am a solo founder building a US-based technology startup called DearlySent. We are building a social relationship network designed to bridge the gap between digital intention and physical action. My goal over the next decade is to serve 100 million monthly active users and fundamentally change the way human beings show care and love to one another.



I personally work 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, and I absolutely love what I do. I am intensely driven, but I cannot scale this alone. I am looking for my right-hand partner. I am looking for someone with high fluid intelligence, deep empathy, and a builder’s mindset to join me on the ground floor.



**My Promise to You (The Anti-Micromanagement Guarantee):**



This is not a daycare. You are an adult, and you will be treated as a peer and a partner.



- I will **never** use Time Doctor, Hubstaff, or any screen-recording software.

    

- I will **never** force you to punch a clock.

    

- I do not want your mechanical hours; I want your mind, your heart, and your soul. We will work in symbiosis to build something incredible. I care about output, execution, and trust.

    



**The Trajectory & Compensation (The 4-Month Ramp):**



I do not pay hourly, because I do not want you to have "hours anxiety." If you build a system that saves us 10 hours a week, you should not be penalized with less pay. I pay a stable monthly salary for your output and ownership. We will scale your salary and your responsibilities together over the first four months:



- **Month 1 (The Foundation): $800 USD / month.** Expectation is roughly 20 hours of focused output a week. You will learn the DNA of the company, help with Ritz-Carlton level customer care, execute rigorous QA testing of our app, and build our initial operations tracking.

    

- **Month 2 (The Builder): $1,200 USD / month.** Expectation grows to ~30 hours a week. You take over affiliate outreach, competitor research, manage video creators, and build our Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

    

- **Month 3 (The Operator): $1,600 USD / month.** Nearing full-time. You take over daily operations so I can focus purely on engineering and marketing. You manage the digital fulfillment prep and own customer support.

    

- **Month 4+ (The Partner): $2,000 USD / month.** Full-time ownership. You are officially my Chief of Staff. You manage the systems, and when we are task-saturated and need to hire more people, _you_ will lead the interviews.

    



**Long-Term Respect & Benefits:**



- **13th Month Pay:** I proudly and proactively pay the 13th-month bonus every December.

    

- **Healthcare:** Once you reach Month 4 (Full Partner status), you will receive an additional $50/month stipend specifically for your local HMO.

    

- **Growth:** A guaranteed minimum 5% annual pay raise, with room for much higher performance-based increases as the company's revenue scales.

    



**Who You Are:**



- **Flawless English:** You will be communicating with our premium US customer base and directly with me.

    

- **Empathetic:** You actually care about people. Our company exists to remind people of their value.

    

- **A Systems Thinker:** You don't just solve a problem; you build a system so the problem never happens again.

    

- **Tech-Savvy:** You embrace AI (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to make yourself faster and smarter.

    



---



### **How to Apply (The 3-Phase Hiring Process):**



To find the perfect partner, I do not read generic cover letters. We are breaking this process into three phases to ensure we are a perfect fit.



**PHASE 1: The Introduction**



Do not send a resume or a cover letter. Instead, record a 3-to-5 minute video (Loom, YouTube, etc.) answering these three exact questions:



1. Explain a complex technical or operational problem you solved in the past.

    

2. Tell me about a specific act of kindness you’ve done for someone recently, or something kind you would like to do for someone.

    

3. What is a piece of technology or software that you believe is perfectly engineered, and why?

    



Attention to Detail Check: Please make the subject line of your application message: "Generosity: [Your Name]" so I know you read this entire post).

Applications without videos will be immediately deleted and not reviewed.  



**PHASE 2: The Deep Dive**



I will review every single video. The top candidates will be invited to Round 2, where I will ask you to record a second video detailing your specific background, your career ambitions, and more personal details about who you are. 



**PHASE 3: The Paid Trial**



The top finalists will be paid $50 USD to complete a real-world practice project for our company and take a brief alignment/personality assessment. You will be actively encouraged to use AI to complete this project.



The final candidate will be offered the position immediately.



If you want to just clock in, do data entry, and clock out, please do not apply. If you want to build a unicorn startup, take ownership of a mission, and grow into a tech executive, send me your video. Let's build something incredible together.

title: Virtual Assistant – Operations & Customer Support
description:
Location: Remote (NZ Business Hours)

Type: Part-time / Full-time (Contract)

About the Role

We are looking for a proactive, highly organised Virtual Assistant to be the backbone of our administrative operations. You will be the first point of contact for our customers and the primary support for our Branch Manager and on-site technicians. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced "tradie" environment and loves turning enquiries into scheduled jobs. 

Key Responsibilities

Customer Communication: Answering incoming phone calls and making outbound follow-up calls to residential and commercial clients.

Quoting & Invoicing: Preparing accurate service quotes based on job specs and sending them promptly to potential customers.

Scheduling: Coordinating the daily and weekly calendars for our technicians, ensuring travel time and job duration are optimised.

Social Media Management: Monitoring and responding to messages on our
 business page to capture leads.

Reporting: Preparing weekly operational reports for the Branch Manager to track job completion and lead conversion.

General Admin: Supporting the team with database entry, document formatting, and other ad-hoc administrative tasks. 

Required Skills & Experience

English Proficiency: Must have native-level or C2 level English (written and verbal) with a clear, professional phone manner.

Experience: 2+ years of experience as a Virtual Assistant or in a similar office management role, preferably within the trade or service industry.

Tech Savvy: Proficiency in Google Workspace (Sheets, Calendar) and familiarity with job management software (e.g., Fergus, ServiceM8) or CRM tools.

Communication: Ability to handle difficult enquiries with empathy and professional problem-solving.

Reliability: A dedicated home office setup with high-speed internet and a quiet environment for taking professional calls. 

Why Join Us?

Flexible remote working environment.

Be a key part of a growing New Zealand service business.

Competitive hourly rate based on experience. 

How to Apply

Please send your CV and a 1-minute voice recording introducing yourself).

title: U.S. Land Real Estate Research Analyst
description:
Please Read Carefully Before Applying



This is NOT an entry-level VA role.



We are hiring ONLY applicants who have prior experience working with a U.S. real estate investor and have performed property research and due diligence before.



If you do not have this experience, please do not apply.







About Our Company



We are a U.S.-based land investment company buying and selling vacant land across the United States.



We focus on:



Direct-to-owner marketing



Land acquisitions



Subdivision feasibility



Property due diligence



Conservative resale analysis



We are building a serious long-term operation and want a reliable tea
mber to grow with us.







Position Overview



We are hiring a Part-Time Real Estate Research Analyst starting at 15 hours/week (with potential to work more hours as business needs rise!)



Your primary responsibility will be analyzing vacant land deals and identifying red flags BEFORE we make offers.



You will NOT be micromanaged.

You must think independently.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (Non-Negotiable)



You MUST already have:



Experience working with a U.S. real estate investor



Experience pulling comparable sales



Experience reviewing county GIS maps



Understanding of zoning classifications



Understanding of floodplain maps (FEMA)



Knowledge of legal access vs physical access



Ability to calculate price per acre values



If you do not have these, your application will not be considered.







Responsibilities

Pull comps and calculate value ranges



Review zoning and subdivision minimums



Check floodplain and topography



Identify red flags (wetlands, landlocked, steep terrain, access issues)



Fill out property analysis sheets



Assist with active deal due diligence



Maintain organized Google Drive & Sheets & Excel Spreadsheets



Update CRM







Skills Required



Strong written English



Advanced Google Sheets/Microsoft Excel knowledge



Independent problem-solving



High attention to detail



Ability to research unclear county websites



Long-term mindset







Hours



15 hours per week starting



Must overlap 5 hours with U.S. Central Time



Flexible schedule otherwise







Compensation



$3-$5/hour depending on experience



Performance bonuses per closed deal



Opportunity for raises and expanded role



We reward loyalty and strong performance.







Application Instructions (Important)



To apply, you MUST include:



The word “Analyzer” in the first line of your message



A brief description of your experience working with a U.S. real estate investor



A screenshot of your internet speed



A short answer to this question:



When analyzing vacant land, what are the first 5 things you check before recommending an offer price?



Applications missing any of these will not be reviewed.

title: Super quick/easy coding project
description:
Very basic coding project for my coding class. I just do not have the time. Need done asap. Entire project takes 1-2 hours. KEEP IT BASIC AND SIMPLE (12th grade level) 



INSTRUCTIONS: 



Scratch Self-Study Exploration (MIT)

Website: 

Time Required: 60–75 minutes

Goal: Learn the Scratch interface and build a working interactive program independently.

STEP 1: Create Your Project

1. Go to Scratch.

2. Click Create.

3. Rename your project:

LastName_FirstName_ScratchExploration

4. Click File ? Save now.

PART 1: Explore the Interface (Answer in a Google Doc)

Before coding, answer the following:

1. What are the three main sections of the Scratch screen?

2. What is the difference between a Sprite and the Stage?

3. What happens when you click the green flag?

4. List five block categories.

5. What does the “Events” category control?

Title your document:

LastName_FirstName_ScratchReflection

PART 2: Guided Build Tasks

Follow each task carefully.

Task 1: Motion Test

• Use “When green flag clicked.”

• Move 100 steps.

• Turn 15 degrees.

Test your program.

Take a screenshot of your code.

Task 2: Keyboard Movement

Make the sprite move using the arrow keys.

Requirements:

• Up arrow moves the sprite up.

• Down arrow moves the sprite down.

• Left arrow moves the sprite left.

• Right arrow moves the sprite right.

Hint:

• Use a forever loop.

• Use if key pressed blocks.

Test before moving on.

Task 3: Looks and Sound

• When the sprite is clicked, play a sound.

• When the space key is pressed, change costume or change color effect.

Test your program.

Task 4: Variables

1. Create a variable called Score.

2. Set Score to 0 when the green flag is clicked.

3. Add a second sprite (this will be the target).

4. If the main sprite touches the target:

o Increase Score by 1.

o Move the target to a random position.

Test it several times to make sure it works correctly.

PART 3: Create a Simple Game

Now apply what you learned.

Your game must include:

• Arrow key movement

• A collectible target

• A Score variable

• A condition (if statement)

• A loop

• An event block

• The game ends when Score reaches 10

• Display the message: “You Win!”

PART 4: Reflection Questions

Answer the following in your Google Doc:

1. Which block category was easiest to use?

2. Which was most confusing?

3. What programming concept does the “forever” block represent?

4. What programming concept does “if touching” represent?

5. How is Scratch similar to pseudocode?

title: Record Label Sales Manager
description:

Founded by Wilmarck, our music merges influences from Kanye West and Drake with motivational themes inspired by Tony Robbins. With over 1,000
 subscribers and 20,
 followers, we aim to inspire and uplift through our music.

- Managing operations, scheduling, and compliance

- Creating memorable customer experiences

- Onboarding and training new hires

- Communicating seamlessly with stakeholders

- Working 45-50 hours/week, including evenings, weekends, and holidays
