title: Revenue Manager, Sierra Sol Elevated Stays
description:
Sierra Sol Elevated Stays | Revenue Manager

Philippines – Direct Hire (Remote), aligned to U.S. hours



Sierra Sol Elevated Stays is a locally rooted, family-owned property management company serving New Mexico and Texas with 1,000+ vacation rental homes across multiple markets. Our love for these regions is what led us to build Sierra Sol Elevated Stays, focused on providing elevated stays for our guests and elevated stewardship for our homeowners. Our goal is to grow in a way that celebrates what makes our communities special, while delivering elevated experiences for guests and thoughtful, reliable stewardship for homeowners.



Our Elevated Promises

Everything we do is guided by our Elevated Promises. They are our operating standard and the way we earn five-star stays and trusted, long-term homeowner partnerships.



Elevated Guest Engagement: Proactive, elevated hospitality from booking to five-star review.

We believe vacations are special, something people save for, plan for, and look forward to. Our job is to make every stay feel seamless and memorable. We anticipate needs, communicate early, check in during the stay, and resolve issues quickly with warmth and care. Our guest journey is intentionally crafted to deliver the kind of responsiveness, thoughtfulness, and attention to detail that turns great trips into truly elevated experiences.



Elevated Home Stewardship: We care for every home as if it were our own.

As homeowners in our markets, we know what true home stewardship looks like. We operate with a proactive mindset of quality, consistency, and pride. Weekly home checks, rigorous cleaning standards, quality control, seasonal readiness, and preventive maintenance are all part of how we ensure every property is clean, protected, and presentation ready, for guests and for you. We treat every home with the same respect and diligence we expect for our own.



Elevated Homeowner Partnerships: We treat each home like our own investment.

Every homeowner has different goals, maximizing revenue, balancing personal use, focusing on long-term appreciation, or simply enjoying peace of mind. Our role is to be a true partner in those goals, not simply a property manager. As owners and operators in these regions ourselves, our guidance comes from real-world results, not theory. Through regular business reviews, thoughtful design and amenity recommendations, revenue and pricing insights, and brand-building support, we help each property reach its highest potential.



Revenue Management is one of the biggest ways we deliver these promises. This is business partnership work. You are a core part of our team, not an outsourced analyst function.



Job Description - Revenue Manager



Our Revenue Manager owns pricing, fee strategy, and performance analytics across 1,000+ vacation rental homes in New Mexico and Texas. You will maximize homeowner revenue and company profitability through disciplined pricing optimization, thoughtful fee architecture, and clear, data-driven storytelling to homeowners and internal leaders. You will build scalable reporting systems, lead owner business review preparation, and partner closely with Finance (reporting to our CFO), General Managers, Marketing, and Business Development to translate insights into action.



The Revenue Manager will own:

• Pricing strategy across all channels to maximize occupancy, ADR, RevPAR, and Net RevPAR

• Fee strategy to optimize company profitability while protecting guest conversion and homeowner satisfaction

• Owner quarterly and annual business reviews: templates, reporting, insights, and preparation support

• Quarterly market insights reporting by market, including context (weather, events, market shifts) and company and unit performance vs market benchmarks

• Rental Potential Analysis process and templates for prospective homeowners

• Amenity and upgrade ROI recommendations for current homeowners (incremental revenue projections and payback analysis)

• Growth analytics and new homeowner identification using tools like AirDNA, Wheelhouse, Audiences, and our CRM, including lead scoring and data enrichment



Working Hours

This role is full-time and will primarily align to U.S. business hours, expect 4-6 hours overlap with U.S. Central Time zone.

• Core hours: Monday to Friday during U.S. hours with flexibility based on business needs

• Weekly revenue standups and market reviews (standing cadence)

• Light weekend monitoring during peak periods as needed for pacing shifts, promotions, and exception management



Compensation and Incentives

• Base pay: $1,800–$2,300 USD per month (full-time, based on experience, STR revenue expertise, and ability to lead multi-market strategy)

• 13th month pay: Provided in December (prorated for partial years)

• Performance Bonus: Quarterly performance bonus target of 15–20% of base pay (annualized), tied to a scorecard

• PTO: Accrues at 1.25 paid days per month (usable after 90 days; no annual rollover)



Location

This role is fully remote within the Philippines.



Role and Responsibilities



Champion the Elevated Promises:

• Lead with an owner-partner mindset, ensuring our recommendations balance homeowner goals, guest conversion, and long-term performance

• Communicate insights with clarity and warmth, especially when market conditions are challenging

• Hold a high bar for data accuracy and defensible assumptions in all owner-facing reporting



Revenue Management and Pricing Strategy

• Own portfolio pricing strategy across channels, including rate plans, minimum stay rules, last-minute strategy, and length-of-stay controls

• Maintain pricing guardrails by market, season, and property type (floors, ceilings, event premiums, and exception rules)

• Monitor pacing daily and weekly, identify anomalies early, and recommend corrective actions

• Partner with GMs and Guest Experience leadership to align pricing with operational realities and guest experience considerations



Fee Strategy and Profitability Optimization

• Design and refine guest-facing and owner-facing fee structures with clear guardrails and internal governance

• Assess fee elasticity and conversion impact, and recommend adjustments based on performance data

• Collaborate with Finance to ensure fee models and reporting definitions are consistent across markets and statements



Owner Business Reviews (QBR/ABR) and Reporting

• Own Quarterly & Annual Business Review templates and associated regular updates

• Segment owners (top performers, at-risk, new homes, premium homes) and tailor insights accordingly

• Prepare performance narratives: what happened, why it happened, what we did, and what we will do next quarter

• Build owner retention risk indicators and trigger internal workflows when performance and sentiment signals indicate risk



Market Insights and Benchmarking

• Produce quarterly market insights reports by market, including seasonality, demand drivers, weather impacts, and competitive dynamics

• Benchmark performance against market data and comp sets where available, and translate into clear, owner-friendly insights

• Maintain a market events calendar and seasonal assumptions library to support consistent forecasting and storytelling



Growth Enablement

• Develop and maintain Rental Potential Analysis tools and assumptions (conservative, base, and upside cases)

• Partner with Business Development and Marketing to create compelling, data-driven sales enablement content

• Lead new homeowner identification by utilizing tools to identify new homeowner leads, building target lists, scoring leads, and loading actionable opportunities into the CRM

• Optionally support initial outreach sequences 
 or text) if structured as part of the role



Amenity and Upgrade ROI Recommendations

• Build an amenity uplift and ROI library by market and property type (e.g., hot tubs, EV chargers, game rooms)

• Provide clear owner recommendations with projected revenue lift, payback period, and considerations for ongoing maintenance and guest experience

• Create upgrade packages and playbooks to help owners d
 faster and align improvements to guest expectations



Tools, Systems, and Operating Rhythm

• Become an expert user and functional owner of tools like Wheelhouse, AirDNA, Audiences, and our CRM

• Build dashboards and weekly reporting for portfolio health (occupancy, ADR, RevPAR, Net RevPAR, margin, lead time, cancellations)

• Establish a structured experimentation approach for fee changes, discount ladders, minimum stay rules, and channel strategies

• Run a weekly cadence with Finance and operations leaders to review pacing, underperformers, and action plans



Revenue Manager Success Measures

• Portfolio and market performance improves across occupancy, ADR, RevPAR, and Net RevPAR relative to baseline

• Fee strategy increases company profitability without meaningfully reducing conversion or owner satisfaction

• QBRs and ABRs are delivered on time with clear insights and consistent data accuracy

• Underperforming homes are identified quickly and translated into actionable plans with internal owners

• Market insights reporting builds trust and reduces owner friction during challenging demand periods

• Rental Potential Analyses support growth conversion and help fill the top of the homeowner funnel



Qualifications

• 3+ years experience in revenue management for short-term rentals

• Experience managing revenue for 200+ units and/or multi-market portfolios

• Experience running experimentation (discount ladders, minimum stay changes, fee tests) with documented outcomes

• Experience using pricing and market data tools (Wheelhouse, PriceLabs, Beyond, AirDNA, etc.)

• Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (modeling, scenario analysis, clean reporting)

• Strong written communication and ability to translate data into clear owner-friendly insights



How to apply

Please submit the following:

• Resume/CV

• Short written note: Why Sierra Sol Elevated Stays, and why this role

• One work sample (or short write-up): A market or portfolio performance insight you have delivered and the actions you recommended

• Provide a 1–2 page write-up (or slides) addressing the following:

Market: Angel Fire, New Mexico

Problem: pacing is down YoY due to lack of snowfall and spring break is coming up in March

Actions: 3 specific actions you would take this week and why, what you would do next to evaluate those changes, and what your expected goals or outcomes would be

Suggested
 subject line: "Revenue Manager, Sierra Sol - [Your Name]"

title: GoHighLevel VA / CRM & Automation Specialist
description:
We are looking for an expert GoHighLevel VA / CRM & Automation Specialist to help us implement, organize, and improve systems inside our company.



We need someone who can help us use GoHighLevel as part of the broader business system — including lead management, client communication workflows, CRM organization, automations, intake processes, appointment flows, and operational follow-through.



Your job is to help us operate and optimize the platform effectively inside our actual company workflows.



We are in the early adoption phase, which means we need someone who can help us set things up correctly from the start, document what is being built, and create a clean foundation we can scale.



**Compensation for this role is up to $6.50/hour USD, depending on experience, skill level, and proven ability.**



## What This Role Will Help With



This role may include:



* Organizing contacts, pipelines, tags, custom fields, and stages inside the CRM

* Building and improving automations for lead follow-up, client communication, reminders, and internal workflows

* Setting up forms, surveys, calendars, and intake flows

* Assisting with funnels and landing pages where needed

* Supporting appointment scheduling and pipeline movement

* Improving lead handling and response workflows

* Reviewing current setup and identifying gaps, inefficiencies, or messy structure

* Helping create cleaner internal processes using GoHighLevel as part of the business system

* Documenting what was completed, what needs follow-up, and what is recommended next

* Communicating clearly about work performed, blockers, and outcomes



## Who We’re Looking For



You are a strong fit if you are:



* **Truly experienced in GoHighLevel**

* Honest and transparent

* Organized and detail-oriented

* Strong in English communication

* Able to explain your work clearly

* Comfortable working inside structured systems and SOPs

* Proactive in solving problems

* Realistic and accurate with time estimates

* Focused on results, not inflated claims



## Important: Please Read Carefully



We have had issues in the past with candidates overstating their experience, overstating hours worked, and providing poor visibility into what was actually completed.



Because of that, this role requires a high level of accountability and proof.



You must be comfortable with:



* Clear task-based expectations

* Defined deliverables

* Honest time tracking

* Regular written progress updates

* Screenshots or Loom updates when needed

* Clear documentation of what was done

* A paid trial task before any longer-term engagement

* Verifiable proof of real GoHighLevel experience



If you prefer vague scopes, unclear reporting, or loose hour estimates without evidence of output, this role will not be a fit.



## Required Experience



You should have real hands-on experience in GoHighLevel, ideally including several of the following:



* CRM setup and cleanup

* Pipelines and opportunity stages

* Tags, custom fields, and segmentation

* Workflow automations

* Triggers and troubleshooting

* Forms, surveys, and intake systems

* Calendar and appointment setup

* Lead routing and follow-up systems

* Funnel / landing page support

* Integrations with third-party tools

* System audits and process improvement



Experience supporting a business that uses GoHighLevel for both front-end lead flow and back-end operational workflow is a major plus.



## What Success Looks Like



The right person will help us:



* Build cleaner, more reliable GoHighLevel systems

* Improve visibility into lead and client flow

* Reduce confusion and manual follow-up

* Create organized workflows we can actually trust

* Produce work that is clearly documented and easy to verify

* Help us scale Reveal Interior Design with stronger operational structure



## Application Requirements



To apply, send all of the following:



1. A short introduction about yourself

2. A summary of your GoHighLevel experience

3. Specific examples of what you personally built, improved, or managed

4. Which GoHighLevel features you are strongest in

5. Screenshots, Loom videos, or portfolio proof (remove client-sensitive information)

6. Your expected hourly rate in USD

7. Your typical weekly availability

8. Your internet speed

9. Whether you have backup internet available

10. Confirmation that you are comfortable with time tracking, written updates, and a paid trial task



## Special Instructions



To confirm you actually read this post, begin your application with:



**“I understand this is a proof-driven GoHighLevel systems role.”**



Applications that do not include this exact line will be ignored.



## Hiring Process



Our hiring process may include:



* Written screening

* Video interview

* Skills-based discussion

* Paid trial task

* Reference check

* Final review based on communication, accuracy, quality, and reliability



We care more about real execution, honesty, and accountability than titles or claims.



## Compensation



* **Up to $6.50/hour USD**, depending on candidate experience, skill, communication, and proven ability

* Paid trial task included

* Long-term opportunity for the right person



## Final Note



If you are genuinely skilled in GoHighLevel, communicate clearly, track your work honestly, and can help integrate the platform into a real business operation — we look forward to hearing from you!

title: Looking for a VA with Long-Form YouTube Video Editing and AI Experience
description:
We're looking for a VA who can handle:



- Editing long-form videos for YouTube

- Scriptwriting with AI and premade prompts

- AI voiceover generation



We run multiple channels and are constantly launching more.



You need to be someone who pays close attention to the content you're creating. You should know the basics of editing and care about what you're producing. This means:



- Making sure visuals in the edit logically match what's being discussed. Visuals must be relevant, not randomply picked.

- Following our SOPs carefully and consistently

- Caring about the final product, not just pushing out content to hit a deadline



Technical skills required:



- Video editing software (Premiere, DaVinci, CapCut, etc.) - you should be comfortable with long-form edits

- Being able to source for video footage, images, and other material that match the script

- AI tools for images, video, and voice over (Nano Banana Pro, Seedream, Heygen, VEO, ElevenLabs, etc.) and basic prompting skills (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT, etc.) — you should know how to use AI to your advantage even though we usually provide premade prompts.

- Basic image editing skills for creating or adjusting visuals

- A capable PC or laptop that can handle renders of 4–12 GB files without taking forever



Preferred (not required):



We will provide detailed SOPs for every niche and we will help and explain if something isn't clear.



Not a requirement but a huge plus: Ability to watch a reference video and imitate its style, pacing, and feel without needing overly detailed instructions.



The right mindset:

- You're okay with "simple" editing if it performs better

- You study what works on YouTube, not just what looks cool

- You can explain your design decisions based on viewer psychology

- You're self-sufficient

- You actually watch the videos you make and ask yourself "does this make sense?"



To get a better picture of what kind of editing you most likely will be doing check out these videos:

- 

- 

- 



Compensation: $350/month



How to apply:

- Introduce yourself and explain briefly why you think you'd be a good fit for this position

- Attach your portfolio of long-form videos you've edited

- Include links to YouTube channels you worked with or specific YouTube videos you worked on



We DON'T need:

- Someone who hasn't edited long-form videos before or has only edited shorts

- Someone who "wants to learn" on the job

- Someone who edits on autopilot without checking if the content actually makes sense



Please start your application with "I EDIT WITH INTENT" so we know you've read the full post.



Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Pen Tester
description:
Key Responsibilities

• Conduct manual and automated penetration tests on web applications, networks, cloud environments, and endpoints.

• Identify, exploit, and document vulnerabilities, providing actionable remediation guidance.

• Perform red team exercises simulating real-world attack scenarios.

• Collaborate with security engineers, developers, and IT teams to strengthen defenses.

• Prepare detailed technical reports and executive summaries for stakeholders.

• Stay updated on the latest attack vectors, exploits, and security tools.

• Ensure compliance with industry standards (ISO 27001, NIST, PCI-DSS, etc.).



Required Skills & Experience

• Minimum 5 years of hands-on penetration testing experience.

• Strong knowledge of network protocols, operating systems, and web technologies.

• Proficiency with tools such as Burp Suite, Metasploit, Nmap, Wireshark, Kali Linux, and OWASP methodologies.

• Experience in cloud security testing (Azure, AWS, GCP).

• Ability to script or automate tasks using Python, PowerShell, or Bash.

• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.



Preferred Certifications

Candidates should hold one or more of the following recognized certifications:

• OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional)

• CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker)

• GPEN (GIAC Penetration Tester)

• CPT (Certified Penetration Tester)

• CREST Registered Penetration Tester

• CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) – optional but valued for broader security expertise



Application Requirement

Applicants must submit a portfolio or proof of work, including:

•  Reports or case studies of penetration tests (with sensitive data redacted).

•  Demonstrated experience in exploiting and remediating vulnerabilities.

•  Evidence of using the above tools and certifications in real-world projects

title: Meta ads publisher - VA Fb ads
description:
We are looking for a highly organized Media Buyer / Ads Publisher to handle the daily "heavy lifting" of launching ads on meta ads manager. You won't need to write copy or design images—we provide all assets and the strategy. Your job is to be the "Pilot" who configures every setting perfectly and pushes the "Publish" button.



This is a recurring, daily role requiring roughly 1–2 hours of focused work per day.



Responsibilities:

Campaign: Build and launch Meta campaigns, ad sets, and ads using our specific naming conventions and provided assets.



Strict Settings Management: Configure exact targeting, budgets, bid strategies, and placements according to our internal guidelines.



Ad Formatting: Accurately input headlines, body text, and URLs. Ensure all UTM parameters and tracking pixels are correctly attached.



Daily Maintenance: Monitor for ad rejections and quickly appeal or fix them based on our policy.



Consistency: Log in daily to ensure new creative "drops" are live on schedule.



Requirements:

Expert Meta Ads Skills: You must know Ads Manager like the back of your hand. No learning on the job.



E-commerce Experience: You have previously published ads for online stores (Shopify experience is a plus).



Extreme Attention to Detail: You are the person who catches a missing "s" in a URL or an extra zero in a budget.



Reliability: You can commit to a consistent 1–2 hour window every day.

title: Performance Media Buyer – Meta & Google Scaling Specialist (Sales Driven)
description:
We are looking for a highly sales-driven Performance Media Buyer who understands one thing clearly:



We don’t run ads for activity.

We run ads for PROFIT.



This role is not for a technical-only setup person.

This role is for someone who knows how to:



• Launch conversion-focused campaigns

• Scale profitable ads

• Kill losing creatives fast

• Optimize CPA aggressively

• Build structured scaling systems



You must have experience with:



Meta Ads (Purchase optimization, scaling, creative testing)

Google Ads (Search + Shopping, intent-based traffic)

Conversion tracking (GA4, Pixel hygiene)

Creative testing frameworks



Important:



You must be strong in creative direction.



We provide raw product content (photos, videos, product info).



You must be able to:



• Create high-converting ad creatives

• Structure product listings for performance

• Write strong hooks and ad copy

• Edit simple but effective video ads

• Build offer-driven angles



We are NOT looking for:



? Someone who only sets up tracking

? Someone who is slow to act

? Someone who needs weeks before launching

? Someone afraid to scale



We ARE looking for:



? Sales-obsessed mindset

? Understands scaling from 0 to consistent profit

? Knows kill rules & scaling rules

? Can manage multiple brands

? Communicates clearly and fast



Weekly expectations:



• 4–6 creatives per ad set minimum

• Structured testing plan

• Daily performance report

• Weekly scaling roadmap



Compensation:



Negotiable based on experience.

Performance-based bonuses possible.



To apply, answer:



What is your strategy when a campaign has spend but no purchases?



How do you scale a campaign from 5 purchases/day to 20 purchases/day?



Show proof of past results (screenshots).



What is your average response time during working hours?



We move fast.

We expect execution.

We reward performance.



If you are serious about scaling brands, apply.

title: Google VEO 3 Specialist
description:
We’re Hiring: Google Veo 3 Specialist



Our fast-growing e-commerce brand is scaling toward 8-figures and beyond, and we’re ready to level up our creative production with the power of Google Veo 3. We’re looking for a Google Veo 3 Specialist to help us manage, refine, and execute AI-generated video ads that support our marketing goals.



To show you’ve carefully read this post, please start your response with the word peach before introducing yourself. Below, you’ll find the key responsibilities, requirements, and a few quick questions so we can get to know your experience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Prompt Creation & Optimization: Write, test, and refine prompts to generate high-quality video ads using Google Veo 3.

- Workflow Coordination: Manage the full AI production pipeline—concept to final output—ensuring deadlines are met.

- Creative Alignment: Collaborate with our marketing and UGC teams to blend AI-generated content with human-made assets.

- Quality Review: Ensure all outputs are polished, on-brand, and ready for launch.

- Innovation & Mastery: Stay up to date with Google Veo 3 features, updates, and best practices to keep us ahead of the curve.

- Documentation: Maintain a clear system for tracking prompts, revisions, and final deliverables.



Requirements:

- Hands-on experience with Google Veo 3 and AI video generation.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to manage multiple creative projects at once.

- Good communication skills for working with both AI and human creators.

- Comfortable using project management tools like Google Sheets, Notion, or similar.

- Consistent availability for 8 hours daily, 6 days per week.

- Bonus: Background in marketing, video production, or AI prompt engineering.



Questions for You:

- Have you worked directly with Google Veo 3 before? If so, tell us about your projects.

- How do you approach prompt testing and refining to get the best results?

- What’s your system for keeping multiple AI video projects organized?

- Are you comfortable balancing both creative expectations and technical workflows?

- Can you commit to 8 hours per day, 6 days per week, for this role?



If you’re passionate about AI-powered creativity and love working with cutting-edge tools like Google Veo 3, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Video Editor for Performance Creatives for Ecommerce Brand
description:
Summary:

We are a fast-growing 8-figure e-commerce brand looking for a skilled and creative video editor who specializes in performance-driven ad creatives for digital platforms. We're building a team of A-Players who don't just execute — they grow, evolve, and take ownership of their craft.

To apply: You must start your application with the word "Red" and provide a portfolio showcasing your best e-commerce video ads. Applications without this will not be considered.

Content Comfort: Our creatives can carry a sexual undertone and intimacy-forward energy. No nudity or explicit acts, but it can be uncomfortable. If that’s a hard no, please don’t apply.



About This Opportunity:

As our Video Editor, you'll create high-converting video ads, product demos, and performance creatives tailored for platforms like
, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube. You'll work closely with our marketing and creative teams to bring our products and brand to life through engaging, conversion-focused content.

This isn't just a job — it's a growth opportunity. We're looking for someone who wants to develop their skills, learn the strategy behind what makes ads perform, and potentially grow into a Creative Strategist or other leadership role within the company. If you want to level up and be part of a high-performing team, this is for you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Edit and produce high-quality videos for e-commerce campaigns (ads, product showcases, social content)

- Source and curate video content, B-roll, and visual assets needed for ad creatives independently

- Collaborate with the marketing team to understand objectives and align creative with strategy

- Optimize videos for each platform to maximize engagement and performance

- Use AI tools to generate images and videos to enhance ad creatives and speed up production

- Rapidly implement feedback and deliver edits on time

- Maintain a cohesive brand style and tone across all deliverables





Requirements:

- Minimum 2 years of experience in video editing, with an e-commerce or performance marketing focus

- Proficient in CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and other relevant editing tools

- Experience using AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, Runway, Pika, ChatGPT, or similar) to generate images and video content

- Strong portfolio of high-converting video ads and e-commerce projects

- Ability to work quickly and manage multiple deadlines

- Excellent communication skills and responsiveness

- Strong understanding of how video fits into paid media strategies

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

- Growth-oriented mindset — we're looking for people who want to develop their skills, learn strategy, and grow with the company

- Must be available to work during New York (EST) business hours

- Content Comfort: Our creatives can carry a sexual undertone and intimacy-forward energy. No nudity or explicit acts, but it can be uncomfortable. If that’s a hard no, please don’t apply.





What We're Looking For:

We're looking for A-Players — people who take ownership, go the extra mile, and care about delivering great results. We value:

- Initiative and resourcefulness — you don't wait to be told what to do

- Curiosity and desire to learn — you want to understand why ads perform, not just execute edits

- Long-term thinking — you're interested in growing your career, not just collecting a paycheck

- Speed and quality — you can move fast without sacrificing the details that matter





Expectations:

- Work with the creative team to iterate video variations and test new formats

- When provided a script or concept, source visuals, B-roll, or content independently using stock libraries, AI tools, or other resources

- Execute quickly and efficiently without sacrificing quality

- Be proactive, communicative, and solution-oriented

- Continuously improve your craft and seek feedback to level up





How to Apply:

- Start your message with the word "Red"

- Provide a portfolio of e-commerce video ads you've edited

- Submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your video editing experience

- Share specific details on your role for each project — sourcing content, editing styles, performance goals, and any results driven by your videos

title: Experienced Architectect for Thermal Peformance Assessment (BASIX & NatHERS
description:
eCerts is a specialist sustainability consultancy delivering BASIX, NatHERS and energy compliance solutions across residential and multi-dwelling projects in NSW.



We are growing and looking to bring on an Architect or Architectural Graduate who wants to develop deep technical expertise in energy modelling, thermal performance and compliance — with full training provided from the ground up.

This is not a drafting role.

This is a pathway into becoming a highly skilled sustainability consultant.



About the Role

You will be trained to:

 • Prepare and lodge BASIX certificates

 • Model dwellings in HERO NatHERS software

 • Analyse building fabric, glazing and orientation impacts

 • Work across single dwellings, dual occupancies, and multi-dwelling developments



You’ll gain strong exposure to:

 • Thermal performance modelling

 • Energy efficiency strategy in residential design



Who This Role Suits

We’re looking for someone who:

 • Has a degree in Architecture or Building Design

 • Has strong attention to detail

 • Enjoys problem solving and technical work

 • Is comfortable working with numbers and data

 • Wants to build specialist expertise rather than purely design

 

No prior BASIX or NatHERS experience required — we will train you.



What We Offer

 • Structured training in BASIX & NatHERS

 • Exposure to real-world residential projects

 • Supportive, small team environment

 • Competitive salary based on experience

 

Why Join eCerts?

We work closely with architects and builders across NSW and are known for practical, solution-focused advice that helps projects move forward — not stall.

If you’re interested in developing technical mastery in building performance and sustainability compliance, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Full-Time Bookkeeper (Remote) Medical / Specialist Clinic Experience Required | Genie + Xero
description:
Full-Time Bookkeeper (Remote)

Medical / Specialist Clinic Experience Required | Genie + Xero



Employment Type: Full-Time (40 Hours Per Week)

Location: Remote (Offshore)

Industry: Specialist Medical Practice



About the Role



Paul Group Virtual is recruiting on behalf of a well-established Australian specialist medical clinic seeking an experienced Full-Time Bookkeeper.



This is not a general bookkeeping role.



We require someone who understands the financial workflows of a medical or specialist clinic environment, including patient billing, health fund reconciliations, Medicare processes, and practice management systems.



Strong English and clear communication are absolutely non-negotiable.



Immediate start available for the right candidate.



???? NON-NEGOTIABLE REQUIREMENTS



Do not apply unless you have:



Proven bookkeeping experience within a medical clinic, specialist practice, or comparable healthcare environment



Strong working experience using Genie Practice Management Software



Strong working experience using Xero



Excellent spoken and written English



Experience communicating professionally with Australian teams



If you do not have Genie and Xero experience, please do not apply.



Key Responsibilities



Daily bookkeeping and financial reconciliation



Managing accounts payable and receivable



Bank and credit card reconciliations



Medicare and health fund reconciliation



Processing specialist billing and patient accounts



Payroll support (if required)



BAS preparation support (with Australian accountant)



Month-end reporting



Maintaining financial accuracy and compliance



Liaising with practice management and admin teams
